Reviews.Title: “A little luxury”
Reviews.Author: harmonyrunner
Reviews.Content: I actually want to give the Sheraton in Baltimore another 1/2 star because it was such a wonderful place to spend the night. It is centrally located in the heart of Baltimore within walking distance to over 25 restaurants. Whole Foods is only a mile away as well. The rooms were luxurious and clean with very nice pillows and bedding. The gym was great and I spent some time on the cross trainer. All the machines seemed to be quite new and they had free weights for lifting instead of one of those crazy machines. I liked that. All and all, I would definitely stay here again. The staff was super-friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: Virginiavacationman
Reviews.Content: Good meeting and private dinning spaces. Accommodating staff. Good meals promptly served. Roof top patio outdoor break space very nice and convenient to meeting space. Guest rooms quiet and comfortable. Every staff person seen was friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chit S
Reviews.Content: It was a nice and fun stay during O's game. Love the receptionist and service. All the stuff are helpful. Gym is outstanding. Swimming pool is abit tiny. It has a Gift-shop but it wasn't look like a gift shop. Felt like it Just put snacks on a picnic table and looks tacky... Great location... Would stay here again if I ever come bk to bmore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, older property”
Reviews.Author: omnipred
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location if you're visiting Baltimore and spending time in the inner harbor area. I had a nice quiet corner room. The building itself is a bit dated, but they keep the property clean. Morton's steakhouse is attached to the hotel, so it's convenient if you want a good steak. Nothing particularly good or bad about my stay, it's what you expect when you stay at a Sheraton/Hilton/Marriott level of property.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in Starwood chain”
Reviews.Author: sandy w
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed in this hotel more than 4 times in the past. It was lousy each time, but centrally located. Never again! This hotel is horrible. On our last visit the staff was rude. Our room was not cleaned. The toilet wouldn't flush! We arrived late and stayed out all day for 2 days so issues were not addressed as they should have been because I was simply too tired to argue with the haughty staff. Trust me. This hotel is not worth 10,000 Starwood points!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Focus”
Reviews.Author: sazer1
Reviews.Content: My brother was getting married in Baltimore and I arranged for much of my extended family to fly in from all corners of the country and we used the Sheraton Inner Harbor as our base hotel. My family members were of all ages, a number of them with special needs, and all the normal chaos and dysfunction that goes along with a big family event like a wedding! While the event wasn't at the Sheraton, you wouldn't have known that based on how they supported everyone. From the valet to the front desk to Rena the outstanding concierge, they greeted us all by name, kept us moving in the right directions, and always did it with a great attitude and a friendly smile. Getting even two people in my family to agree on a place to eat is a small miracle, and from restaurant reservations to transportation support to special needs in the room, they handled everything without missing a beat. From my perspective, any hotel can have a great staff member. This hotel has a great staff. Everyone is clearly enabled to not just respond to your needs, but to anticipate them. I felt so fortunate I had chosen this hotel because their service was so good, I didn't have to worry about my elderly parents or my young cousins or my aunt that can't make up her mind. My family is like herding cats, and the staff at the Sheraton Inner Harbor were like the cat whisperers! Beyond the service, the rooms were fine, location is great, lots of places to eat and visit nearby, and great access to the Metro (in and out from the airport) and Camden Yards. I wish I had the staff at this hotel organizing my life at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Topguest511
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sheraton for the weekend to celebrate my son's 2nd bday and take him to the Aquarium. The location was great - walkable to all the right spots. The staff was pleasant and very accommodating from making sure we got adjoining rooms to providing us with milk at 5am (at no charge) before room service and the restaurant opened. The rooms were clean and spacious. Overall, this was a fabulous weekend and we would definitely return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy but can we lose the attitude??”
Reviews.Author: gflyer2012
Reviews.Content: Very comfy rooms as with most Sheratons these days (Lagos the exception to the rule as always of course!) with good beds, clean carpets and bathrooms with nice amenities. However, perhaps a little staff re-training wouldn't go amiss. Make that: A LOT of re-training.. What attitude!! In fact, just frankly rude most of the time in particular the staff on reception. It never used to be an issue here but has become one over the last few years. They really don't seem to get that you are the guest and deserve at least a modicum of civility, let alone an acknowledgment that you exist as you stand waiting for one of them to decide he or she is ready to speak to you. Then hardly look up at you as they "serve" (loosest sense of the word) you. I always feel as if I am an inconvenience that they are desperate to be rid of. Amazing how their attitude completely changes depending on what you look like. I have actually had the humiliation on two occasions of having a staff member call forward a guest who was clearly behind me in the queue as they were obviously more the kind of person the staff wanted to deal with. I believe he referred to him as his "brother" on one occasion so maybe that was the reason... A total disgrace. And a terrible mark against the Sheraton name and the people of Baltimore. I shall not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: paul w
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here many times with my work have become used to what to expect. The first thing you will notice is the very loud piped music outside the front doors which becomes very annoying especially if you use the benches to have a smoke. Reception is of average size but is so drab and dreary and really needs a complete facelift. The staff here are a bit hit and miss. There are some PC's in reception offering free internet access.. a nice touch. Adjoining reception is Mortons Steak House again decorated with very dark colours and not very welcoming. The Gift shop sells the usual tack with drinks and snacks etc but on this visit it was closed. The room itself is actually quite good very comfortable clean beds, it looked as though the room I was in had recently been decorated so perhaps they are starting to upgrade.. Forget the TV its the normal tosh, 2 minutes of programming followed by 5 minutes of ads. Bathroom was clean and well appointed, however one thing that continues to surprise me and worry me is that the Hairdryer sits adjacent to the sink so very possible to get it wet unless you move it. Surely this should be the mounted type on the wall, (out of the reach of children). Room service is expensive however you can order food from the bar and take it to the room yourself. As mentioned before the staff are a bit hit and miss however the guy in the Bar is efficient, helpful and polite. Cleaning staff need to be aware of different sleeping patterns and should endeavour to keep 'Quiet' in the corridors, being woken at 8am wasn't appreciated. Location is good only a couple of minutes to the Harbour area

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticuTourist
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel close to the Convention Center and the Sheraton Inner Harbor was a good choice. I had some SPG points to use and the price was right. The reviews I read here prepared me for a hotel that was in need of updating, but to my pleasure, that was not the case at all. My room on the 15th floor was very nice, attractive and comfortable. The housekeeping and restaurant staff were friendly and attentive. Check in was impersonal, but not offensive. The hotel restaurant was in need of updating and overpriced, but the server was nice. Additionally, there is a Morton's restaurant in the hotel and though pricey, both food and service were well worth it. If you're going to dine at the hotel,spend a few extra dollars and enjoy Morton's.The hotel has easy access to the Convention Center and a quick walk to the Inner Harbor. The American Visionary Art Museum was a short taxi ride from the hotel. Great surprising museum of artists who are not formally trained and create vibrant, personal and fun artworks. I highly reccommend a visit to this delightful museum during your visit to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great employees, location and value....”
Reviews.Author: marsim
Reviews.Content: I was wondering what I would find here after reading a few reviews about how tired and dated this Sheraton is. Must be that there have been some recent renovations - I found it to be perfectly clean and very comfortable. Above all, the staff was top-notch, especially the bell-hops - they were all professional, friendly and helpful. We are planning another stay within the next month because we loved this hotel so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Outrageously expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: smcmahon1202
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful, but the pricing put this one my list of places to never return to. It is absolutely outrageous to charge $31 for a sandwich and $17.50 for cereal and milk and $20 for pancakes. Will NOT be returning. Walls are paper thin as well. I heard everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Allison T
Reviews.Content: We checked in last night and checked out today. Short little getaway. This was an awesome hotel. I will come back next time we are in Baltimore. The staff made us feel like celebrities. I am a manager at a hotel hours away and could only dream of having a staff like this. From the gentlemen who checked us in to the girl who checked us out were so nice. All other staff in surrounding areas always said hello and with a smile. They were all happy to be there and aimed to please us. You have no idea how far a smile can go. It was a home run for us!! Room was super. I loved the nice bedding. I am very particular with bedding and this was so comfortable. Just to give you a little feedback is the area in the parking lot isn't clearly marked to get to the lobby. We parked in the green section. We saw an elevator but the signs next to the elevator had arrows pointing away from the elevator saying "lobby" . We followed the signs to the lobby and it took us to a stairwell and we had to walk up 4 flights of steps to get to the lobby. The signs had us take the steps. We appreciate the exercise but not when we were tired and had to carry luggage. We were a little fired up when checking in and the nice gentleman that checked us in was so nice and apologized with a smile for the inconvienience when we told him about the signs giving us directions by way of the stairs. Once we got there and check in, everything was just perfect. The staff made it so nice, I can't say enough nice things about them. I especially want to recongnize Crystal. She waited on us while we ate the breakfast buffet this morning. She was so friendly and upbeat and made a rainy day seem sunny. Thank you to all of the staff the for making such a nice getaway. We will now continue to stay on a regular basis when we go to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, hotel needs major update”
Reviews.Author: JandPdineout
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in the last 2 months, the staff is excellent, but the rooms are badly in need of new beds, furniture, etc. Forget the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I would steer clear to be honest....”
Reviews.Author: MountPleasant
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here roughly 6 times over the past 3 years. I have to be honest, I am not certain if this is a Starwood franchised hotel but the fact that this place is given a 4-Star rating is pretty sad to me. I realize it a is Convention hotel so it gets a lot of wear, that said, I just couldn't tell you what is 4-star about it other than location. I am a Starwood Platinum member-for those of you that don't know what that means-it just means I spend too much time in hotels. The rooms are worn. Even the club floor rooms are terribly abused. The linens were something I would have expected from a $49.95 a night motel. The restaurant upstairs is dark and to be honest, lacks any type of atmosphere, thought the food was well below average. I am tired of paying for lackluster hotel food when on the road. I just simply can't suggest this place to anyone any longer. To the hotels credit, they are in a great location and they are kind upon checkin-quick and responsive, that said if you aren't set on staying at a Starwood property there are plenty of other choices downtown I would suggest checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Leroy Smith deserves a raise and a promotion!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTwit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property because we were seeing a play at the nearby Lyric Center. We would normally drive to Baltimore from New Jersey but this trip, we took the bus. We arrived at the Sheraton at around 10am and figured we had NO chance of checking into a room that early. However, we had the pleasure of being assisted by Leroy Smith and we were so glad!! He greeted us with a warm smile and professional attitude...he was also impeccably groomed, which for me is a huge plus. Nothing worse than seeing an employee looking thrown together. He never mentioned the fact that we were hours early for check-in; he simply found us a room, gave us our key and bid us a good day. Here is the rest of the breakdown: Hotel: VERY clean! I even saw a woman going up and down the escalator with a sweeper. I was impressed. The room: We were in room 726; a very nice corner room with ok views. The room was SPOTLESS. Again...very impressed. Staff: The gentlemen at the front (doorman I believe) were very nice. They always greeted us as we came in and left out and were very good with assiting us with cabs and information. All of the staff members I came in contact with were extremely pleasant. Another plus! Restaurant: We ate at Orioles Grille Bar for breakfast. Juan was our server and was very good. He was very attentive but not overbearing. There was also a woman who was refreshing the food who was very nice (I want to say her name was Linda but I'm not sure). The food was pretty good. No complaints. We also ate at Orioles for a late night snack. My husband got a cheeseburger and I had loaded fries. Both were good. Even though we came in 15 minutes before quitting time, they took our order with a smile. Very much appreciated. Location: Very close to everything. Prime location for entertainment, restaurants and of course the Inner Harbor. The ONLY reason I gave this hotel 4 stars is because of the location of the bathrooms; they are on the 2nd floor and kind of hard to find. Besides that, this hotel is a winner. We will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: krr1234
Reviews.Content: While there were some good things about this hotel, the negatives stood out so much more that a Poor rating was necessary. We checked in at noon, and had no problem with an early check-in. Having traveled across the country all morning, we took a nap in the room before we had to be somewhere later that afternoon. In the middle of our nap, we woke up to find a Sheraton employee in our room, quickly scattering out. I ran to the door and looked down the hallway, seeing the employee leaving. He said he entered the wrong room. While this may be the case, it does not take away from our startled feeling of waking up with someone in our room. The room itself was older and had some remodeling done to bring it up to date a bit. Still nowhere near a 4 Star room. As reported in other reviews, the walls are way too thin. We could clearly hear every word of the conversation taking place in the room next door. The location is good and close to M&T Bank Stadium, Camden Yards, Convention Center etc. However, I would pass on this hotel as there are many others nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kosam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4 times over last 7 years and saw definite deterioration both in service and the condition of the facility. Given the age of the building, some limitations are understandable, but a major rehabilitation is needed to upgrade this hotel's standard to the level of newer hotels in the area. Last I stayed at this hotel was this week. Location is excellent, 5 to 7 minutes' walk to beautiful Inner Harbor and a few extra minutes' walk to downtown. Good place to stay if one wants to go to a ball game. Rooms are medium sized, with excellent view of inner harbor from some rooms and of the stadium from some others. Furniture in the room need upgrading. The chest of drawer and the table were old. The drawers are almost useless -- a bare 7/8 inches in depth and one has to be careful to open them. Thermostat to control temperature in the room was not working very well. Front desk staff did not seem particularly friendly, although there was not a long line. But checking in was quick and efficient. The bar is nice with a friendly bartender. The restaurant is average. However it is rather dark inside and does not give a warm feeling. Specially at breakfast time, it gives a rather gloomy feeling. One good thing: Morton's restaurant located in the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Your standard convention center hotel...yawn”
Reviews.Author: LBinDC1
Reviews.Content: I sometimes feel that if you've stayed at one Sheraton Convention Center property, you've stayed at them all. Certainly, nothing about the Baltimore location would make me feel otherwise. As stated above, this property is located next to the Baltimore Convention Center in a great part of the city. Just off the Inner Harbor, you are close to shopping, restaurants, the aquarium, "World Trade Center", IMAX and other major tourist and commerical attractions. The location is definitely one of the properties strong selling points. Unfortunately, as is commom with many Sheraton properties around the world, this one feels as if it was built in the 80's, and apart from some minor refurbishments, pretty much looks like a dated 1980's establishment. Rooms are comfortable, but bland. Bathrooms are adequate but nothing very exciting, meeting rooms met our needs & the gym/pool area is fine for a quick workout, but nothing more. There really is nothing wrong with the hotel, it's just a very standard facility. If you're travelling for business reasons, this hotel is fine. If, however, you're looking for something a little more modern, a little more hip or even a facility which feels a little more exciting, try one of the hotels on the east harbor instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for convention center!”
Reviews.Author: BTMNSP
Reviews.Content: Easy jet bridge walk to convention center and inner harbor attractions. Great gym facility (with dry sauna) Only had pie from restaurant, but it was it was yummmmmmy. Staff very helpful. Rooms, AC was a tad noisy and bath was clean but not pristine (haved watched too many exposes to tv...not bad, but....). Ask for feather free (if you are like me and allergy nut case) BEFORE you sleep on pillows. I learned hard way that they assume folks are NOT allergic.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, no problems”
Reviews.Author: easygoingrunner
Reviews.Content: quiet at night, nice room, pleasant multi-night stay, very convenient to convention center and harbor, skip the Oriole restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to Convention Center, Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: MnDaisy
Reviews.Content: Our stay was part of a large conference in the almost adjacent convention center. You can walk out the second level and across an outdoor courtyard to the center. Our room was clean and a nice size. We did have a problem with the tub draining but staff were immediately sent up to solve the problem. All the staff in the hotel were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. Location is only several blocks to the Inner Harbor shops and restaurants. A 20 - 30 minute walk to Fells Point, Harbor East and Little Italy. Only a block away is a stop for the Charm City free bus. The Oriole Grill/Bar has good draft beer and munchies. There is an adjacent parking ramp at a cost of $25/day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: PECCruiser
Reviews.Content: I love the fact that this hotel is walking distance to the harbor where tons of restaurants and shopping is located. I went for a walk after work every night and always founf something to do. The bar at the hotel was just enought for nightcap. The entire staff at the hotel was very friendly and tries to make you feel at home. The fitness room has new machines and it also has a seperate weight training room. Parking garage is great and easy to find spots, I parked right by the entrance every night I was there(4 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family reunion”
Reviews.Author: augustamom
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, clean and well laid out. Beds are comfortable. The location is great. Staff is friendly and helpful. The Concierge recommended the best italian restaurant, called ahead for us and our large family group was seated immediately. The health club is fanastic as well. Three pools and a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: Again a very typical stay at this hotel. Iv reviewed it before and really no difference this time round. Very friendly staff, clean rooms, good location for Baltimore and this time I managed to connect to the wifi in the room no problem! It may be nothing special but it's nothing bad either!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: todclifton
Reviews.Content: I recently traded in some Starwood points so my son and I could have "guys weekend" at the Inner Harbor. The location cannot be beat. The hotel is about 5 minutes away from the Baltimore Museum side of the harbor, so you arrive next to the main buildings, water taxi, and tour boats. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were very clean. Bed was very comfortable, and room layout was quite good (easy to walk around, unpack, etc.). Keep in mind, this is a Sheraton, not a Westin, W, or St. Regis. It is a workaday hotel. Our room was very clean, but there was a noticeable stain on the carpet. The bathtub was fine, but I would not let my son (he's 6) bathe in it. The pool was more of a large hot tub than a pool, though the fitness center looked fairly decent. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shelb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Inner Harbor for a business trip. My main purpose for choosing this hotel was the location. The location to the convention center was perfect. Literally, just a couple hundred yards away. The location to the inner harbor was also great, within about 5 minutes walking. Great shops and restaurants. The rooms were standard. One odd thing was the location of the clock radio. It wasn't next to the bed(s), it was on the desk on the other side of the room. The walls were paper thin. I could hear hallway noise and with the door for the adjoining room, I could hear conversations clear as day. Internet wasn't available in the rooms, I needed to go the lobby for wi-fi access. A connection the room would've been nice. I even brought my own ethernet cable, but had nowhere to use in the room. Had an issue with the room card not working once. Had to head back to the lobby to have it re-activated, not exactly convenient since I had my arms full. Only because of the location, would I return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business travelers”
Reviews.Author: mattxwill
Reviews.Content: Me: Business traveler who stays weeks on end in hotels. Staff: Average. Rooms: Nice clean rooms. Beds: Very comfortable. Firmer than marriott inner harbor, but not as nice as hiltons Gym: Recently remodeled. Food: I havent eaten at the restaurant. See below Concierge Lounge: The best in the area I think. You can have a full dinner if you wished. Breakfast is great too. Internet: Average. Better than Marriots iBahn system. Value: Good value overall of the better hotels near the inner harbor (see my other reviews), SPG promotions while i was there made it a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but staff were not too friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sunblader
Reviews.Content: Great location in the updated Sheraton near the Harbor. Our room was upgraded, I believe, to a great view and for that we are appreciative. However, the Doorman NEVER opened the door for us - ever - don't know why. Front desk seemed more interested in talking to each other than giving us attention attention. (Why are staff allowed to have mobiles on the job I'll never know.) Spent the next night at the Hilton Baltimore...a few steps down the road. Amazing experience there. It was night and day experience between the two. The Hilton staff were so friendly and they genuinely seemed to be happy we chose to stay with them. Stay at the Hilton over this Sheraton- that would be my suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “great accomidations”
Reviews.Author: h0ckey67
Reviews.Content: the hotel stay was excellent .clean, comfortable rooms, extremely helpful staff!!! close to shopping ,dining and many attractions..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: whode
Reviews.Content: The hotel was even nicer than I remembered it from my last visit two years ago. It has either been renovated recently or it has been very well maintained. The rooms were nice, quiet, and clean. We stayed on a club floor though at first I couldn't find the club room (it was on the floor below). The breakfast in the club room was more than the typical continental breakfast and the staff was extremely nice. One downside is that the hours seemed a bit limited. The location is also very good. Although it's not right on Inner Harbor, it's only a block away and within easy walking distance to all of the attractions on the harbor. It's also easy walking distance to Camden Yards in the other direction. Parking struck me as a bit expensive for a small city at $25, but it was convenient self-parking in a garage (this garage apparently is also used for people attending Orioles and Ravens games, so I don't know if it may fill up during events). One of my main reasons for visiting Baltimore was to go to the National Aquarium. I made a big mistake and didn't buy tickets for the Aquarium ahead of time so by the time I went to book them online, all of the morning times were sold out. Because of my schedule I thought I might have to miss seeing the Aquarium, but when I called the hotel front desk, they said they had tickets that were members tickets which allowed you to go in anytime--and they turned out to be cheaper than buying them directly from the Aquarium! I would definitely stay again the next time I visit Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable and CLose to everyting!”
Reviews.Author: GoodLifeJP
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable stay in more than adequate accomidations. The rooms were very clean, the amenities were excellent and the silence in the rooms was unbelivable - no bleed of sounds from rooms or the hall. Close to attractions in the Harbor and all the great places to eat. Parking was easy no long waits for your car. Had a wonderful weekend and slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Graceology
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. The staff was spot on perfect, the food in the Orioles Grille upstairs is fantastic and they went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Will definitely be back. Great location to the water, restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but very average”
Reviews.Author: giniajim
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that could be so much better with a little work. First, it does have a great location, with a view of the Inner Harbor (which is just a couple of minutes walk), and a short walk to Camden Yards, where the Baltimore Orioles play. The rooms are fine, but again pretty average. Bed, couple of chairs. Our room was close to the elevator, which was annoying. The lobby is fine, but nothing to get excited about. There were computers for guests to use in the lobby, but using them was awkward. There was apparently a guest account or password; I got it to work once. Better for internet access was my Android accessing the local wireless net work (not the hotel's). The room rates were much more expensive than the hotel warranted, probably a result of being the Orioles "official" hotel. (We were there for a game and there were a *lot* of out-of-town fans there.. like us). There are several competitors in the vicinity and we'll definitely check those out on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY VIEW OF THE HARBOR”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCampy
Reviews.Content: Located one block form Camden yards and the Inner Harbor.Be sure to check rates because they change.I saved $82.00.Oriole grill way overpriced.Eat in the harbor.Nice clean rooms &good service

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ryan R
Reviews.Content: we stayed Saturday night for my sisters wedding place was great !! Very clean and friendly !! WE WILL BE BACK SOON !!

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on the weekend of Hurricane Irene. The staff and management, went out of there way to exceed all of our needs. They greeted everyone with a friendly welcome at all times. I have nothing but praises for this establishment. We were there for my son's wedding and what Irene accomplished the Sheraton erased. Bravo to the Sheraton. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: dru37
Reviews.Content: This is a definitely a good choice for baseball and football fans in town to see their favorite teams, an easy walk to both sports venues. And it's right next to the convention center. It's a block or two away from the inner harbor, but can surprisingly feel off the beaten track, especially at night when there are no games or conventions in town. The property itself is your standard big Sheraton property. Nothing fancy, nothing to offend. We had a room on the concierge level and it was clean and spacious, but the bathroom was pretty small compared to the room size. Bed was comfortable, a/c worked just fine, and they have nice size flat screen tv's. Overnight self-parking was $25 which is ridiculous but unfortunately ranks as reasonable for downtown city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Will seek alternatives in the future...”
Reviews.Author: GRBuckeye
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent business trip and bottom line, this hotel felt dark, aging and not that clean. While it appears that the hotel has done some cosmetic things to keep it feeling current, it's age is showing. The entrance immediately gave me pause when I arrived...windows and doors in the entrance looked cloudy. Upon entry, the hotel smelled of musty seawater. The rooms were a 5 on a scale of 1 to 10...I couldn't help but question the cleanliness, noticing stains in the carpets and sticky, damaged and dated furniture. Yes, I guess you could call me a hotel snob. Have stayed at many around the world and I have high expectations...I like bright, fresh, modern and new. I do not recommend this hotel unless you have no other alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: biswadeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sherton Inner harbor two nights on first week of July. We have a room with Inner Harbor view. It was fantastic view from the room. Service was excellent.There are plenty good resturants nearby. We'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: AandJTravelers1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very professional during a very busy time: weddings, the hottest weekend of the year with slow elevators due to the heat, and a busy and eager baseball crowd. Our room was spotless and comfy with a nice view. The fitness center is very new and spacious. The pool isn't great; but it did seem like the kids in there enjoyed it. Everyone who worked there was very kind. The parking was a pretty good deal, too (considering the other rates we paid in Mid-Atlantic cities). Also, the Sheraton is a stone's throw to both Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor. I love to see great cities come back, as Baltimore has! It's a testament to the city, the people, and nice hotels like the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: midoririta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to take my nephew to a Baltimore Orioles game. Perfect location!! Few blocks from stadium and easy walking to harbor and all the great attractions there. Specifically booked a room with stadium view... but wasn't given that at first. Called down to the front desk and recieved and apology and was told someone would be up to move us right away. Waited little over 10 mins in a room without AC on, and getleman showed up with new rooms keys and took ours and advised we needed to go up 1 floor, no assistance with luggage. New room had great view of both stadiums, but no AC on and it was really hot out. Hotel should turn on AC before guest arrives in room. Sink made a gurgle sound for about 5 mins after you turned it off, kinda odd. Rest of the stay was great. Staff in the dining room for breakfast was great and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely accommodating in every way!”
Reviews.Author: joe3kidsme
Reviews.Content: I will preface my remarks by saying that I spent 40 yrs. in the serv. industry & am also an old geezer and can be a harsh critic. I write to praise Kathleen Curtis and her team who did everything in their power to guarantee a successful visit to Baltimore. Moreover, they succeeded! Thanks to all at the Sheritan Inner Harbour and as Arnold would say "We'll be back"! Joe Fitzpatrick - Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: McAlex
Reviews.Content: Staff couldn't be nicer. Easy check-in. Room ok, not too dated, but getting there a bit. Next door left the tv on all night and we could hear it, so that wasn't too great. And the next night his cell kept going off from 6am on. Just saying that the walls are thin. Some issues with calling for the elevator due to the extreme heat wave - but this seems sort of weird. All in all, an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1967foodie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel for one night on 7/3/2011. We were leaving on a cruise out of Baltimore the next day and wanted to see the inner harbor. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the inner harbor and its possible to get there without using the sidewalks – there is a walk over to the convention center that leads to the inner harbor. Did not eat at the hotel's restaurants. Check in was very smooth and efficient - staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was fresh and clean with one of the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept on. Water pressure in the bathroom was great as was the temperature. Would love to stay again and have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what's up with all the negative reviews?”
Reviews.Author: wakeforestjerry
Reviews.Content: Booked my room through Priceline, so didn't know which hotel I would be staying at until after it was booked. Then read Tripadvisor comments and thought it was not going to be a pleasant stay. Front desk was very pleasant upon check-in. Although we didn't get a King bed, the accomodations were very nice. The hotel was hosting several business events and was sold out. Did not have any noise problems, bedding was very nice, room very clean. a/c worked great in a heat wave. Now for the location...downtown Baltimore is like most big city downtowns. Many homeless and others linger all the way to, and in, the Inner Harbor. Felt comfortable walking to the Inner Harbor area at 8 PM, but took a short cab ride ($10) back to the hotel at 11. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay..”
Reviews.Author: SJTraveler
Reviews.Content: For the second year our retiree group of 8 had a great stay at the Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel. With the help of Rena Kenely, we had the breakfast package and late checkout. Everything about the hotel has been great, the welcome staff, Concierge, restaurant staff and the rooms. Will definitely return. Hotel is great location for harbor area and Oriole Park at Camden Yards. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A very standard Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: It does what it aims to do as a bog standard Sheraton but there is nothing particularly special about this hotel. Rooms are comfortable and contemporary. My TV had a terrible reception on it however and no room service menu was in my room which simply list them some extra revenue cos it motivated me to just go out and eat. I also couldn't log onto the wireless from my room, when I rang down I was told that it must be a fault with my laptop!!!! However neither my laptop nor iPhone could connect from my room but both worked fine in for the free wifi in the lobby! The pool is no bigger then a hot tub so don't expect to be doing laps as a work out, just stick to the cardio facilities or weights equipment. Otherwise this is a nice hotel which is very nicely located by the inner harbour!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: virginiahighlander
Reviews.Content: I am currently here with my 7 y.o. son. I read ALOT of reviews on Inner Harbor hotels before choosing this one. Good- Location. Not right on the water. Your views are other hotels and office buildings. Crossing the street to get to inner harbor, shops, aquarium, etc a little tricky. Alot of road work/paving going on in the area. Cleanliness. Room very clean as well as hotel lobby, pool, gym. Pool. VERY small 3-4.5 ft in depth kiddie pool. My son loves it! Lifeguard on duty too which is unusual (but nice!) for hotel pool. Gym. Modern, clean, great equipment. Bad- Hotel shop. Not well-stocked and very expensive. Breakfast. Didn't eat the food so can't speak for quality. $20 for eggs and $17.50 for oatmeal seems a bit ridiculous. GREAT- So far all staff have been friendly and warm and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: proftravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend to catch the Reds/Orioles games and go to Fort McHenry. The location was perfect: not too far to the Inner Harbor to catch the water taxi and then not too far to walk to Camden Yards. I got a great deal on the room here. Room was big and quiet, and I had a great view of the Inner Harbor/downtown area. I did eat at the Orioles Grille downstairs and it's pricey-service was good but the price for food and selection wasn't the best. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “front desk rocks!”
Reviews.Author: 1Christelle88
Reviews.Content: upon check in and check out, the front desk was very delightful!!! I got to practice my french with the lovely desk at the girl who was extremely nice I believe her name was Elie. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: dhdbutler
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property. Pleasant staff, clean and comfortable rooms and great food. Within walking distance of the harbor and other places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CsMagnum
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location, near harbor and Orioles stadium. A little pricey but high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway weekend”
Reviews.Author: Chloe014
Reviews.Content: We absolutely enjoyed our "getaway weekend" at the Sheraton Inner Harbor for Memorial day weekend. We decided that Baltimore would be a good city to explore for the long weekend and booked a club room through SPG. As always we were very happy with our decision. Hotel staff is friendly, professional and courteous. The hotel is located near Inner Harbor but have to admit that I had to "drag" my husband and son out of the hotel as they did not want to leave the comforts of the bed and room. They were more than happy to relax stay in the room! I did manage to get them to leave the room with much resistance and we enjoyed the restaurants and local area sites via the water taxi that took us to Fells Point and Fort McHenry. I highly recommend this hotel is you are looking for convenient access to Inner Harbor and excellent hotel accomodations and service.

Reviews.Title: “Close to harbor, stadiums and trains”
Reviews.Author: BobBarnett
Reviews.Content: But $10 oatmeal ($17.50 in rm) and $12 per day WiFi-Gimme a break. What they call a swimming pool is just a kiddie wading pool

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!! A Must Stay for Future Visits”
Reviews.Author: PtrainerNY
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was great! From the doorman to the front desk, to the club lounge, to it being steps from Camden Yards, having a Mortons inside. As a SPG Plat/Marriott Plat Premier I travel to many hotels and this is high on my list of places to stay if in Baltimore or nearby. (If it's the carribean or staying here the carribean wins)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, all that we hoped for, for our family trip to the Inner Harbor.”
Reviews.Author: JennyC724
Reviews.Content: There were 8 of us staying in two connecting rooms, including 4 children ages 3-10. The rooms were comfortable and clean. We asked for connecting rooms and we asked to be high up if possible when we checked in. The front desk staff was uber helpful and gave us everything we asked!! I pricelined these rooms for $80 each per night, which was a total steal! We were only one block and easy walking distance to the Inner Harbor, where we spent all our days. The pool was small but big enough for the kids to play in every night, which was perfect. My ONLY complaint is the lack of affordable room service!!! The prices on those room service menus for the on location restaurants were CRAZY high!! I would stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...not so great room.”
Reviews.Author: tpw525
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a great hotel....only a couple blocks from Camden Yards and a few blocks from the Inner Harbor. We booked thru Hotwire and upon arriving to our room, we found ourselves in a handicap room. We didn't mind the low bed, rails near the toilet or in the shower but we did have issue with the condition of the bathroom. It seemed as though the room had been recently renovated but someone forgot to update the bathroom. There was old, dirty caulk in the corners, rustry shower rails and a rickety, rusting pole holding up one end the the sink. The bed was hard as a rock! We've stayed in Sheraton's in the past and loved their cushy beds and "heavenly" pillows....but this bed was the equivalent to sleeping on a slab of sheetrock. I won't give up on Sheraton but I will not pay full price to stay at the Sheraton Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “C minus”
Reviews.Author: goob007
Reviews.Content: agree with others that it is old and tired esp for the high rates. Room Thermostat requires a lot of programming to get stable temps. Room smelled like heavy doses of air freshener. Will say that Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Inner Habor is the place to Stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hoboken11
Reviews.Content: Dear Jon and Katie, I am writing you both to let you know what a valuable asset you have in Le'Roy Smith. I travel roughly 20 nights per month around the world. When I can, I also start with SPG hotels as my first choice. With my travel schedule, it is also tough to see my girls. This weekend we are together here at your property. Le'Roy has made our trip one of the best experiences I have ever had at a Sheraton property. His outgoing personality, his willingness to make us feel welcome and comfortable has made the trip special. As an equity owner in my business, I feel it is important to recognize people who go beyond "the job description". Le'Roy's passion in what he does is outstanding and needs to be stated to those making decisions. I will always make this property my only choice when in this area. You will be seeing me again and I will make sure my sales staff also stays here. You both are luck to have an employee like Le'Roy! Sincerely, Frank Petruno SPG#50363274223

Reviews.Title: “Too Pricey for the Quality!”
Reviews.Author: rbarrett900
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night (thank goodness) on Saturday, April 9th. We were in town for a Baltimore Orioles game with another couple who stayed in the hotel too. We each spent $200 for a room (+ $24 for parking) that had paper thin walls and thin connector doors that allowed us little sleep. We were awoken by the guests next door who turned on the TV at what I discovered was probably a reasonable level but due to the thin walls sounded like it was in our room. We could also hear their entire phone conversations. I turned on the noisemaker of my iPhone at full blast but still could not drown out the noises coming from the other room. Our other friends staying at the end of the hall had the exact same experience though unforunately for them they were awoken at 3AM instead of 6AM. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is not a very sound sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: rollocst
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Sheraton was a good place to stay in Baltimore. I'll nit pick on some items but in general it was a very nice place to stay. The hotel is in a convenient location between Camden Yards, the convention center and the Inner Harbor. Our room had an angled view of the harbor which was a nice surprise. The room size was average and the room was reasonably modern. The beds and pillows were good for us though the sheets were a bit rough. The bathroom was updated though I can't understand why hotels seem to replace everything but the shower heads and recepticles. Ventilation in the bathroom seemed non-existant and it led to the room being a bit humid as well. I was pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel although housekeeping never seemed to make it to my room earlier than 2:30 or 3pm. On the plus side we were able to get in our room before 12 noon on our arrival day which was helpful. The Sheraton is a good place to stay even if it isn't great in any categories other than location. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Cowgirlinphilly
Reviews.Content: Even though we were only there for 1 night, the service from start to finish was fantastic. From the person checking us in to the head chef who cooked the best buffet breakfast I've had in a long time, everything was perfect. The room had everything we needed and the location of the hotel is perfect as well. The only thing I wish we had known about sooner was the walkway that connected the hotel to the inner harbor. This made it much easier to go from place to place once we discovered it. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DCFLYER_22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and every staff member I encountered was friendly and quick to help. The room was simple but roomy and the furniture was in nice condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Sheraton Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: 46327Nancy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Inner Harbor for business. Hadn't been to Baltimore for a while so it was nice to go back. The convenience to the Harbor was great, we actually took a nice walk back from our dinner at the Rusty Scupper. The entire staff from check in to food and beverage was very accomodating. The Club Attendant Wanda was a pleasure to talk with. The hotel was in great shape and I really enjoyed the view of the city! Will definitely plan on returning with family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joemacg
Reviews.Content: Service was great throughout the hotel. There were smiling faces at the front desk, in the restaurant, and in the guest hallways and public areas. The room was very clean and comfortable. The Sheraton bed is the most comfortable of all hotel brand bedding. The location is perfect for business or pleasure with the Inner Harbor in walking distance. Any restaurant of choice is available in the Harbor. The stadiums for both football and baseball are seen from the guestroom windows.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service ever.”
Reviews.Author: farcpr
Reviews.Content: Every person I dealt with at the hotel was courteous and friendly. I never passed a hotel employee without getting at minimum a smile and an acknowledgement and an offer to help if they thought I needed any. The room was sparkly clean all the time and I only saw the maid once when I asked if I could have decaf. I had decaf the rest of the trip. The only minor glitch was when they overcherged me slightly for the internet but when I pointed that out they fixed it with a smile. My stay was otherwise perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...not if it was the last hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: sparkee187
Reviews.Content: Anyone that says anything positive about this place is obviously an employee trying to drum up business. The only positive is the location, yet again an empty box placed in the center of the inner harbor also has a nice location and would be cheaper and more comfortable so I'd opt for that next time. My room was, well, a bed...they attempted to squeeze in some chairs which i could catapult over the bed to get into if i so wished. The white comforter was stained, the white shower curtain was stained, the white towel was stained, the wallpaper behind the bed was dark and had a white stain on it...gross. The vent blowing directly on the bed was so filthy it was unbelieveable - there was a solid 3 inches of dust and filth covering it so we had to turn it off and deal with the room getting colder by the minute. After entering the hotel within about an hour or 2 my eyes started to get itchy and burn and become very dry...this lasted the entire time I was there. My mom and aunt were in staying in separate rooms so total we had 3 rooms on 2 different floors. My aunt also experienced issues with dry irritated eyes. Myself and myboyfriend developed a cough/dry throat from the dust and dirt in the room. But the worst was when we went to bed...i felt something...something irritating my leg then on my arm, at first i thought the sheets were itchy and my skin was just dry. Then I felt it on my face, it was like a little bite. I felt it on and off throughout the night, my bf did not but his skin is much thicker than mine. My aunt said the next day she experienced the same thing. Luckily we were only staying one night or I would have switched hotels. Now I have to figure out what to do with my bags of clothes sitting on my front porch that I'm afraid to bring inside.

Reviews.Title: “Location..Location...Nothing More”
Reviews.Author: VoyageursNJ
Reviews.Content: I guess with a price of $87.00 a night one really should not complain. So to make this short if you want a good location 1 block from the Inner Harbor then this works... HOWEVER getting a good nights sleep was a challenge...thin walls allows you to hear then someone is in the bathroom or is using the blow dryer. The sink in the bathroom made noise when the water was running in the bathroom above the room I was in.

Reviews.Title: “Split Personality”
Reviews.Author: HKlimes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel this past weekend, because it was convenient to a dance competition in which my daughter was competing being held at the Baltimore Convention Center. I was generally satisfied with the hotel at first -- the rooms are nice, the view was good, the hotel was very convenient to the Convention Center, and there was ample parking on site, even if it was expensive. However, when we returned to our room that evening, it felt like we were in an entirely different hotel. There was an extremely noisy party going on on the second floor, the people attending the party appeared to be very sketchy, there were security guards (associated with the party) all over the place. I didn't really feel safe at all. In addition, many of the people attending the party appeared to be staying in the hotel -- they were loud, noisy, and drunk in the hallways and in neighboring rooms. While the front desk was responsive when I called to complain, I don't believe it was within their ability to control the noise level or their behavior of the guests staying at the hotel or attending the party that evening. If the hotel wants to attract families and similar types of guests, it should not host these types of events. I'll stay elsewhere next time I'm in downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Baltimore Customer Service and dirty room.”
Reviews.Author: IMJetlagged
Reviews.Content: Typical, "ho-hum" nice, run of the mill, modern Sheraton decore. For some reason the Sheraton hotel believes it is OK to give a customer a fold out closet bed for 3 nights because they haven't sold the "attached suite" room as an "attached suite". And they forgot the mattress cover. I made 2 face washers filthy by wiping down all of the smeared and dusty surfaces such as desk, phone, bedside table ... areas used on a daly basis by most guests. They do offer Starbucks coffee in the room but that doesn't help if you prefer white coffee. No fridge, no microwave. You can hear everything in the hallways and in the attached room next door. As for service ... there is just something terribly WRONG with the attitude of the workers in Baltimore, it's as bad as Atlanta - generally speaking. I went to the front desk later in the evening and all three people were sitting down below the counter - it was unapproachable as if a guest might be interrupting THEM. That said, the ladies who worked the lounge on the 14th floor were quite personable and helpful. Gone are the days of first class, 5 star service but at least these ladies warmed up to guests that arrived for a quick bite. That said, I just don't think that Hotel management encourages "professionalism" in the work place anymore ... again, generally speaking. One guy at the front desk though very nice had poor dental hygiene and when I went down to the cafe for an expensive toasted cheese sandwich they fobbed me off with a velveeta cheese atrocity. I remember when the Sheraton was great, the customer was always heard and valued, the customer NEVER felt they were interrupting or inconveniencing or expecting too much from hotel employees. It's a sad sign of the times ... mostly found in Baltimore and Atlanta. Looking to end on a positive note, as I think this hotel's downfall is that it's in Baltimore, so if you HAVE to be in Baltimore the location is right next to the convention center and a few blocks from the water front. I have stayed in a number of downtown hotels and regretfully this one is probably as good so as you'll get so I will recommend it. You just have to make the most of the stay yourself because they don't reach out to do it for you. ~ apologies for a rather negative review ... customer service and cleanliness industry standards everywhere in American hotels seemed have dropped drastically in the last 10 to 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Convention Hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: svnscaa
Reviews.Content: I like the access to the East end of the Baltimore Convention Center. Always a great stay here, excellent room upgrades, nice concierge lounge, first floor access to Morton's Steakhouse and friendly staff overall. Also have stayed here for Orioles and Ravens games.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again unless someone else was paying.”
Reviews.Author: TravelrAva
Reviews.Content: I stay at various Sheraton locations for both business and pleasure, but this is one location I won't be revisiting. The room was okay, dated a bit, but that was to be expected. Found most of the employees seemed to be disgruntled and frustrated except for the gentleman who delivered room service. He was quite pleasant. I visited the bar and was one of three people there. The bar was promptly closed at 10:30pm, which I thought was strange. However, I do realize an empty bar is not the way to make money. After settling in to the room, sleep was interupted at 4am with a couple screaming wildly outside my door and multiple slammings of the heavy metal doors. In the hotels defense after 15 minutes too long of listening to arguing and door slamming, I called the front desk. They said they would send security up promptly and they did so. Just left wondering what type of hotel this was I just stayed at, and feeling sleepy. Not my type of hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas - Baltimore was closed!”
Reviews.Author: westsussex10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, over Christmas. The hotel had hardly any guests, and seemed to be running a skelton service. My daughters wanted to use the pool, but when we got there on Christmas eve it was locked. I had to walk down to reception, and they got a guy to come and unlock it for us. On Christmas day, the waitress, who had been there since 6.30am, told us we were the first guests to appear for Breakfast at 9.30! Christmas Day evening, they closed the restaurant, and we had to eat in the bar area (the previous night, we were told the children were not allowed in this area). The location is close to the harbour area, where there are a few restaurants (all closed at Christmas), but not really a lot there. I accept that this was probably not the best time of year to review this hotel. The staff were friendly enough, the food was adequate. The rooms were nice, though they could do with new showers in the rooms. I would describe this as more of a business kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Customer Focused Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelon1980
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel during a conference that was helping organize. The conference staff was extremely helpful and very easy to work with. The hotel is in the perfec location for people who want to go and explore Baltmore. The food during the conference was delicious. The rooms were very comfortable. My one complaint was that the room was very hot and the thermostat did not work. There was also noise throughout the night from the pipes in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Servicing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmb357
Reviews.Content: I planned and coordinated a conference for my agency with this hotel. From the beginning the sales manager was very customer oriented doing what ever she could to accomodate my needs. My site visit with them was the best of all the hotels I visited because of the sales managers pleaseant disposition and her desire to make our agency happy. In addition to the sales manager, the conference sales manager was an extreme help in ensuring that I had everything covered that I needed to make my conference a success and it would not have been as successful had it not been for her input. There were many things I had not considered. We had approxiamately 50 people attend the conference and they all loved the hotel, the service and the location and indicated on the feedback sheet that they would indeed recommend this hotel to others. Strong consideration should be giving if this is one of your choices to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Starwood Property in Downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous737
Reviews.Content: Purpose of stay: Long term consulting project in Baltimore The Business Travel Sales Manager is very attentive and knowledgeable about the city. It was a a pleasure going through her for any needs. All you have to do is ask. The front desk staff are warm and welcoming. I left baggage over the weekends and have never had problems. The inner harbor and many restaurants are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and conference location - situated in the heart of Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: jatl30311
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at your hotel in early November. I just wanted to take a moment to say that the entire trip was a pleasure. Business trips are an inevitable part of my world, and it is great when you have a good one. I have to say, the service was excellent and my colleagues and I loved the location. Such a fun part of town! I will be sure to stay with you again, whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in hotel and services”
Reviews.Author: Granbymom33804
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay started with the trash not being emptied from the previous guest. The workout room was very warm and inadequate for a hotel of this size. All of the stations on the TV did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Bills game”
Reviews.Author: Tim226
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a Buffalo Bills football game in Baltimore with a group of friends and was very happy with the accommodations at the Baltimore Inner Harbor Sheraton. The rooms were bright, clean and overlooked the harbor and the staff was helpful and efficient. Situated a short walk from the football and baseball stadiums and the Inner Harbor this hotel is in the perfect spot for visitors looking for things to do in Baltimore. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “National Network with Partnership Schools- Best Event ever”
Reviews.Author: mclays93
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three days during the NATIONAL NETWORK FOR PARTNERSHIP SCHOOLS conference and loved the location in downtown Baltimore -1 block to the Inner Harbor. Excellent accommodations and the staff was friendly and helpful. Everyone was very attentive with our needs, specialy the sales manager, Itze Alonzo. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and a wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: InnovInstitute
Reviews.Content: We recently held a large conference at the Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel. It is a fantastic hotel, located in the heart of downtown Baltimore. It is central to many of the great things this city has to offer: the Inner Harbor, Oriole Park at Camden Yards, Fells Point, M&T Bank Stadium, the Aquarium, Science Center, and the Gallery Mall just to mention a few! As the conference dismissed each day, there were plenty of things for our attendees to do, all within walking distance. The guest bedrooms are also very well equipped, and offer beautiful views of the city. There were over 550 guests in attendance at our conference. The hotel staff were always extremely courteous and helpful. As small problems arose, the staff were always accessible and more than willing to help. Without this partnership, our organization would not have been able to pull-off such a successful conference! Regardless of whether you are traveling for business or pleasure, we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Baltimore. We look forward to partnering with the Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spurman87
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Inner Harbor is one the best hotels that I have ever worked with. They know what they are doing and you can sense this as they only put the best foot forward. I have been a returning customer for over 4 years and wouldn't go anywhere else. The rooms are nice- the beds SIMPLY AMAZING!!!! I could sleep all day in one of those beds. The rooms are clean and tidy. The hotel staff is as kind as can be. Always helpful and friendly. They are VERY good with food allergies as well. Working with a company that dealt with food allergies, this hotel get's it. The chef AMAZING!!!!! The sales team AMAZING!!!! I recommend this hotel to any event planner or just a person who is looking for a great hotel to stay. The location is wonderful- right across the street from the Inner Harbor and the Orioles baseball field. Thank you Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: conwaytours
Reviews.Content: I have groups that travel to Baltimore to see the Red Sox play the Orioles every other year. Every time they have stayed at the Sheraton Inner Harbor. I find the staff (especially Itze) a joy to deal with she makes my job easier. The hotel is located a couple of blocks away (within walking distance) to the games and the passengers like the fact that they can come and go as they please. The hotel also supplied a wonderful brerakfast this year for the group and their was not one complaint. I would highly recommend this hotel to any group of Individual that needs a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location staff is very helpful and effeicent.”
Reviews.Author: dbasile
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a great location rooms are adiquit enough carpets could be newer but the rate is affordable staff is excellent . bar is accomadating alittle pricey need beer specials. food is excellent. if booking for a large group i recomend using itze alonso very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: melocollea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Inner Harbor hotel in June for the second time, due to the outstanding experiences that I had, I will be returning in a few months for a 3rd conference. The meeting rooms are always set up as needed, the food is great, and is always served on time. The banquet and front desk staff are a pleasure to deal with. I can truly say that the Itze Alonzo from the sales team is always very receptive to the needs of my clients. The Sheraton is perfect for meetings and conventions, with all of the meeting space being located on the same floor. I can not say enough about the Sheraton. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is in need of a great venue.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place for a conference!”
Reviews.Author: acharai
Reviews.Content: I organized a conference at the Sheraton Inner Harbor on October 21st. It was a great day – in large part due to the wonderful staff at the Hotel. I worked with Randi Hilfiger. She was always helpful and very professional. She was there to answer all my questions before the conference and she was calm and organized the day of the event (especially when I was not). At one point during the planning process, Randi was required to be out of state due to a family emergency. I worked with Bill and he was able to pick up where she left off. It showed great teamwork between the staff. I would highly recommend using the Sheraton

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisbon19
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here while in Baltimore on pleasure. The room was outstanding, nice view and very clean. The bed was beyond comfortable and the location of this place is great. One block from the Harbor and convenient to the Harbor restaurants. Would definitely stay here again. The staff was wonderful and it is a great place at a great price right in the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: salt13
Reviews.Content: I recently held my third meeting at the Sheraton inner Harbor and am looking forward to hosting my fourth. The entire process, from sales to event is always well organized, well prepared and well executed. Kelli in sales does a fantastic job of anticipating my needs and prepares the catering and meeting staff accordingly. The meeting rooms are always set up exactly as needed, breaks served on time and when guest rooms are needed, the front desk and housekeeping staff are a pleasure to deal with. I would strongly recommend this property to anyone looking for a great location and a stress free large group meeting!

Reviews.Title: “Our Amazing Wedding Experience with the Sheraton Inner Harbor!!”
Reviews.Author: buxfan1972
Reviews.Content: What can I say about Randi and the rest of the staff at the Sheraton Inner Harbor? We selected this hotel because we wanted an Inner Harbor setting, and yet have affordable rooms for our guests as they were staying at least one night, and many two, because the majority of our guests were from out of town. Randi was amazing taking care of everything for us so we literally had nothing to worry about. Any concern we had, she addressed before our big day, and the day of the event, she and her staff had everything completely undercontrol and we had one of the smoothest and most enjoyable wedding ceremonies and receptions imaginable!! It was so convenient having everything all in one location, and with a professional staff (both the hotel staff and the event staff), the weekend went off without a hitch. I can't say enough wonderful things about the staff at the Sheraton Inner Harbor. For anyone looking to have a wedding in the heart of downtown Baltimore, on the waterfront, this is the place to be. The accomdations, the pricing and the service provided can't be beaten!!

Reviews.Title: “needs complete renovation and better service!”
Reviews.Author: SilkeK
Reviews.Content: There are much better hotels around the Inner Harbor to stay and enjoy; the hotel needs complete renovation, parts of it are completely dirty (elevators, carpet floors not vacuum cleaned daily, etc.). The air-conditioning in the room is very loud and you wake up when it turns on at night! You here the neighbours coughin and talking in the room next to you. The service at the front desk is not very polite; the breakfast buffet rudimentary; you sit in a dark furnished room with 4 televisions surrounding you so that you cannot talk quietly at the table! One of the internet computers did not function in the lobby, but it had not been repaired on the next day! So, we and all other collegues will not stay in this hotel again, when we come back to Baltimore soon.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely beautiful hotel with an awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: angelsav
Reviews.Content: The rooms were gorgeous and very clean! The staff was so nice and catered to all our requests! All of our guests were so satisfied with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “If the friendliness of the staff matter to you - this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: jer_lat
Reviews.Content: I am a consultant who spends many, many nights away from home in hotels. The staff at the Sheraton Inner Harbor in Baltimore understands the life of a consultant and works hard to make things a little easier. Comfort, convenience, and most of all friendliness, are hallmarks of this location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, whether a consultant using it as a home base, or a family up for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: cutesister
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Baltimore and wanted a place close to the Inner Harbor as well as to Camden Yards. The Sheraton is 2 blocks from Camden Yards and approximately the same distance to go to the Inner Harbor. Location is centrally located. There was 4 of us in our party and we had a room with 2 double beds. We stood for 3 nights. The room was small. Not a lot of room to maneuver around the beds and dresser. After a day there was so much dust on the dresser and the maid service didn't clean it. We just had the bed made and received new towels. That's it. We ate at the Oriole Grille restaurant in the hotel for their buffett breakfast. Food was good and plentiful and Shon that works there was so friendly and helpful with tips and information about the city. Our accomodations were OK and I guess we were expecting a bit more from the Sheraton name. Next time we will try another hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, dated hotel, indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: haconstruct
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on way back "home" from Belgium. Rooms were really nice, hotel showed it's age. Had to stand in checkout line to talk to customer service agent as there is no seperate spot for them. Is close to inner harbour and stadiums, but over priced. No charm, just a nice business hotel, consistent with waht the Sheraton brand has become, alas......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DebOmega
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Sheraton Inner Harbor for a family weekend with the Sales manager, Amy Mueller. Thanks to her, we had a great room with a view of Camden Yards, which thrilled my family since we went there to see an Orioles game. The hotel was only 2 blocks from Camden Yards and 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor. Great location. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are newly renovated with flat screen TVs, wonderful bedding with duvets and awesome pillows. And the best of all, coffee maker with Starbucks and Tazo Tea in the room! The front desk staff was very friendly. There is an internet cafe and free wi-fi in the lobby. Wi-fi in the rooms, but not free. Parking is $25 per day, but that is standard in Baltimore city. Indoor pool and gym, which we didn't use because we were out and about most of the time. Would recommend this hotel! Deb, York, PA

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from the Sheraton brand”
Reviews.Author: mrsslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the baseball game, the Orioles vs. Texas Rangers, August 21-23, 2010. This is a great hotel if you are going to Camden Yards. It is a 7 minute walk from the hotel to the ball filed. The hotel lobby was beautiful and smelled wonderful! We did arrive early and the room was not ready. We have never had this issue, so they took our luggage and we waited in the lobby. Now, granted we should have asked for an early check-in, but apparently that was not available at the time. We waited in the lobby for about an hour and a half and an employee, Rena the concierge host, approached us and asked if she could assist us. We told her our dilemma and she left, then 10 minutes later she returned with our room keys and off we went to get ready for the game. Now, we paid for a stadium view, but when we opened up the curtain there was a gorgeous view of the Hyatt. Now, I'm not complaining because we were happy to get a room a little early, but still not what we paid for. The front desk staff in general are unfriendly, but the housekeeping staff were so nice! I would only stay here if I absolutely had to. Rooms seem a litte dated with their seating choices. The bath tub could have used an update, but overall it was an ok room. Happy Traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jaftravelers
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is only a short walk from great food, the waterfront, and the stadiums. For anyone that likes to leave their hotel room in the evening this is a great choice. The only thing that could be improved is the air conditioning tends to make a lot of noise which can be distracting at night if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “I appreciate the service sincerely.”
Reviews.Author: BonnyKurian
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Inner Harbor hotel is a service oriented hotel. I have not received such quality service in other hotels. Actually I was looking for a hotel that gave me a decent rate and parking. I received both and top of it exceptional service. The staff makes sure that the traveler's every need is met, even with the little things. I am impressed. As I travel every week to Baltimore this hotel has become my second home. I am relaxed and very comfortable staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Stay in the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: kimschweiler
Reviews.Content: We just spent two days at this hotel with our young children and dear friends. The hotel had everything that we needed and was in the best location-very accessible to 95 but only a hop, skip or water taxi ride away from all the main attractions. The hotel restaurant staff was very friendly and very patient with our young kids. We would stay there again and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 Star - NOT even CLOSE”
Reviews.Author: 310Arapaho
Reviews.Content: Staff was NOT customer focused or oriented, definitely left with the feeling it was a great bother to have guests. This was a consistent theme throughout hotel. The most accomodating person was the concierge, who was knowledgeable but stood in the lobby and was difficult to have a closed conversation without others interrupting. Bedding and bed was highly uncomfortable, it seemed to be a queen mattress on a king frame. Bathroom needs work, etc. All in all it was a great dissapointment. Area was fun, close to baseball etc. But could be sooo much better. I am embarrassed for the mgmt of this hotel. They need to get their staff customer focused.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh...”
Reviews.Author: newyorkfamily1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night this past week at this hotel. The Sheraton Inner Harbor Baltimore has some pluses and some minuses, making it.... ehh..... Pluses: Location - VERY close to Inner Harbor, easy to find, walking distance to Oriole Park, etc. Lobby - Has free internet access on computers. Parking - Option for self parking to save a few bucks. Minuses: Front Desk Staff - The young lady that checked us in was very curt, and seemed very inexperienced in hotel customer service. From her saying "Next, when we were in line like this was a supermarket", and no "Welcome, or how are you?". She just punched a bunch of keys, didn't ask high or low floor, how many keys,etc. She didn't tell us the usual 'We have you down for one night, 2 doubles, blah blah blah." either. Then her fake niceness and smile at the end of checkin made it even better - not. And when we asked about breakfast the next morning, the man at the front desk was also very rude. Not a good first impression. Hotel Decor - You can certainly tell this hotel is very old and worn. It wasn't dumpy, but some maintenance is going to be crucial very soon. Hallways - The hallways are also worn (stained carpet, scuffed up walls, etc.) The decor here was outdated. Room - The room (especially the bathroom) was pretty small. The beds were small, uncomfortable, and the linens were thin and very noisy when moved. The thermostat was very difficult to figure out and it kept kicking on and off during the night and very loudly I might add (it woke me up about every half and hour). So, obviously, didn't sleep that well. The bathroom was small and two people could barely fit. Even the flat screen TV was weird. The picture was too bright and all the people and all the scenery were white as a ghost! The coffee maker was pretty good and the view was very nice, though. Parking - Although it was good there was self parking, it was VERY difficult. The spots were tight, it was a long walk up to the lobby, and it was very dark and dim. It didn't seem all that secure either so take your valuables with you. Also, you only save 7 bucks a night for self versus valet. Do valet for the extra cost.
