Breakfast - The only option for breakfast is on the second floor in a restaurant. It is EXTREMELY overpriced! A small yoghurt parfait was 15 dollars. Uhh, WHAT? There's also no Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, McDonalds, etc. anywhere near the hotel so you're stuck with that breakfast. I've been to this property before (about 8 years ago). Hotels are supposed to get BETTER over time (renovations, feedback=changes, maintenance, etc.) Unfortunately, this one got worse! I wouldn't exactly recommend this to a friend due to the minuses said above. Also, the value wasn't very good either. I'd pick the Hilton right up the road next time......

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: sandrakevin
Reviews.Content: Staff at the hotel were great, Rena and front desk staff very hospitable. Hotel common areas not up to scratch cleanliness wise. Front forecourt dirty, room smelly, halls needed a good vacumn. Hotel in good position and rooms a good size. Great internet available in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - exceptional staff and service”
Reviews.Author: dhdbutler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent staff and service. It is very clean and decorated nicely. Amy Mueller, Business Travel Sales Manager has exceptional customer service skills. She is prompt in responding to requests with a a "can do" attitude and her demeanor with guests and staff is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay, even if paid for as well.”
Reviews.Author: wgifan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel late July 2010. The only plus is location. Maintenance is not done on rooms, air conditioner filters are totally clogged and we lost all hotel air conditioning on the night of heat advisory. Drain made funny echo noise at all hours. Pool is small and not heated, then overheated for hottest day of year! Don't use water bottles in room-they are $3 each, but be careful, water came out of tap BROWN one morning of our stay! If you go through any security scans (convention center) your room key will be erased every time-so plan on getting a new key made EVERY time you go back to your room. Check your car over well after the overpriced valet parking. My rims were scrubbed 3x and we did not see until at home-so tough luck for us.

Reviews.Title: “OVER Priced”
Reviews.Author: JayL07607
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in a bad location for access to the waterfront although there are limited amount of rooms with a view, if you want to look at a housing project acrss the street or the walls of the baseball stadium this it the place... As for the inside it was clean and the staff not so attentive, as for the restaurant, 19.95 @ day for in room internet access and $4.50 for a cup of coffee or Orange Juice for breakfast should be an indicator as to how much you will need to payoff your stay here. And when you try to contact a manager to discuss some issues with hotel security or the front desk they are nowhere to be found. I was there midweek in July on a trip paid for by someone else and will not be returning, even if the rooms were free.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SF8971
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to Baltimore on business, and have stayed at theSheraton Inner Harbor Hotel on several occasions. The attention to detail across the board at this hotel is excellent. Mya and the entire staff there, are always friendly, genuine, and expeditiously responsive to any issues that may occur. The views facing the Inner Harbor are second to none. I would highly recommend this hotel that extends five star quality service at reasonable rates. SF

Reviews.Title: “Remember weekend”
Reviews.Author: loveable25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was around everything. The baseball stadium was just two blocks away. The Harbor was just 1 block away from the hotel. It was my 10 Anniversary, Mike Flint was wonderful he had a made a reservation for us at a resturant in Fells Point, which he had a limo pick us up at the hotel, after we return to the hotel Mr. Flint had a bottle of wine in the room waiting for us to enjoy. He made this anniversary one that we never will forget as long as me live.

Reviews.Title: “Orioles weekend in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: SJTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our party of 8 had a great weekend trip to Baltimore to see the Orioles. The Sheraton Inner Harbor offered a great location and fantastic offer. We had an early check-in, free full American breakfast, from menu or buffet, and a 4 PM checkout. Rena Kenely, Concierge, provided us with great tips and perks, particularly for Power Plant Live. Thanks for your recommendations, Rena. To top off the weekend, the Orioles won

Reviews.Title: “This was average.”
Reviews.Author: bztraveler23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I was exhibiting at an art festival in Baltimore. The bar/restaurant had great service and atmosphere. The room was clean and comfortable. Our coffee maker was broken the first morning and it took over 30 minutes for them to bring us another one. There was never more than one package (one cup) of regular coffee in the room. We had two people in our room and had to call down for more coffee every day. I had one issue I needed to speak with the front desk about. The man there really could care less and had a bad attitude. The pool closes at 8 p.m. and considering the excruciating heat of Baltimore at that time, we wanted to use it, but never could because we were at our art festival past then. The parking is very expensive. I would recommend this hotel for many reasons, just be aware that the service (EXcluding the restaurant/bar) is not the greatest.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are a let-down.....”
Reviews.Author: Speedbird275
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels of the many, many properties I stay at each year. The location is superb, in one of my favourite cities in America. The facilities on offer are absolutely adequate for travellers on business or vacation; with swimming pool, gym and a great restaurant available on site. However, the staff here - namely the reception staff - are a real disappointment. They seem entirely unenthused all the time. They take a long, long time to process what seem to be fairly standard enquiries and sometimes appear to get themselves too involved in guest issues which results in other guests being kept waiting.... and waiting..... and waiting for service. Service with a smile is rare on the front desk here, but to be honest, the rest of the hotel's features make up for it. The rooms and common areas have been recently renovated. The standard of the rooms is second to none and the beds are the usual havens of comfort you get from all Sheratons in the US. Free internet access is available in the lobby area "Link at Sheraton" for 45 minutes per room, per night and this is via either one of the provided desktop PCs or on your own laptop via ethernet. Wifi in your room is provided by AT&T at $9.95 per day (but be warned - you don't get 24 hours, per se, you get access from 3pm til 3pm so if you sign up at 3am in the morning, you'll only get 12 hours......)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms but hotel will nickle and dime you”
Reviews.Author: amiricolblue
Reviews.Content: I was pleased when I arrived as the hotel looked very nice and the customer service was top notch. When I went to my room I was happy to see two bottled waters, but that feeling quickly faded as I saw a tag on the bottles notifying me that each bottle was $3!! Im use to hotels providing bottled water at no charge but they also charge for the starbucks coffee they leave at the in room coffee makers! I would not go to this hotel if you want to swim or cool off in a pool. The swimming pool was super small and the water was warm and after being outside in almost 100 degree weather this was definitely a disappointment. The hotel charges $25 a night for parking with no discount, imagine staying there 5 nights, thats an extra $150. I felt robbed after staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: greenpony
Reviews.Content: Trip was Mom and 12 year old visiting Baltimore to see baseball games at Camden Yards. The good: Clean, comfortable rooms, pleasant staff. The less good: Rooms in need of refurbishing, no in-room safe, no refrigerator. The not good at all: No air conditioning one night during major heat wave - room temp reached 80. Orioles Grille is a typical overpriced, not very good hotel restaurant. The breakfast buffet was very limited and many items were cold. Location: Perfect for Camden Yards, Ravens Stadium, Harborplace, the Water Taxi. Not convenient to restaurants other than Harborplace. Had to walk a couple blocks to get my morning coffee for less than $6! Despite the convenient location, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: family-vaca11
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel in the Inner Harbor is in a prime location; walking distance to every attraction in the city! The service from the moment you pull up to the hotel until you leave the parking garage is impeccable! The employees are friendly, helpful and courteous! They all go out of their way to make sure your stay is wonderful. The food is fantastic - my husband and I were able to enjoy cocktail hour on the Club level with great appetizers (favorite were the scallops), our boys were able to enjoy the food as well -it is very rare we are able to travel and find a great place that meets the needs/expectations of our little ones’ taste as well as ours. The suite we stayed in was perfect; it had every amenity we needed, was spotless and had a beautiful view. I would recommend this hotel to all travelers with or without children. My husband and I stayed in the hotel in May of 2009 for the Preakness and had the same delightful experience without of children!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: bmorefan
Reviews.Content: We have stay many places before but the sheraton at the inner harbor was fanstaic, people were friendly, staff was excellent, food was fanastic. We had the lunch buffet with was unbelievable. It was only walk distance from shopping, resturants and great attrations. I would recommend this hotel and will stay there the next time I am in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location and good rate - most important in our opinion”
Reviews.Author: trinigirlmd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a king room at the Sheraton Inner Harbor from July 2 – 4, 2010. I’d originally booked the Holiday Inn Express (across from the stadium) because I’d read that it was a block or so away from the Inner Harbor. However, when we did a Google Map search we realized that the HI was actually a bit further away than we’d read, although they do offer a shuttle to and from the Inner Harbor. Who wants to waste time hanging around waiting for a shuttle in the heat? The weekend we were there the first two days we were blessed with cooler weather in the 80’s with a gentle breeze. By Sunday it was extremely hot. My husband did some extensive research and found that the Sheraton Inner Harbor was only a block away. I found a really good (pre-paid) rate, so we were sold. We arrived around 12:30 pm on July 2 and since our room was ready we were allowed to check in. We were placed on the 6th floor in room 633. I’d asked for a king room with a view of the water. Because of its location, the Sheraton isn’t necessarily on the water. However, we did get a small view of the water nonetheless. The Sheraton has a nice lobby area. You walk into the lobby and it was always fragrant, well-lit and pleasant. However, the rooms themselves do show some wear particularly the carpets, which seemed very grungy. Our room had the basics: computer desk, desk chair, king bed, TV, dresser and two arm chairs. There was no ottoman, which I always appreciate for elevating my feet. Our room was fairly large for two people. It would have been nice to have a fridge and/or a safe though. For the price and location (and I checked bunches of hotels) I believe we got wonderful value at the Sheraton. This was one instance where my husband knew best. You walk out the hotel’s front door and walk for a block and you’re right at the Inner Harbor! In terms of the additional charges – as of when we stayed there Internet was $9.95 per day and self-parking was $25 per day. We couldn’t get out of the parking fee but used my husband’s Droid phone for Internet. We just hooked the phone to our laptop and it worked fine. Internet speed was very fast too, which was surprising. I truly hate paying for Internet when traveling on business and I especially hate it when traveling for pleasure. A block away from the Sheraton is the Visitor Center. I strongly advise everyone to stop by (even if you’ve done a lot of research on what you’d like to see or do). On the first afternoon we were in Baltimore we stopped by the Visitor Center and chatted a bit. We decided to do the 90-minute Baltimore tour ($24.95 per adult). You were picked up in an air-conditioned bus in front of the Visitor Center. We found our guide to be knowledgeable but “crusty” ;-) The tour was definitely worth it because it gave us a lot of Baltimore history and allowed us to get our bearings and see the stuff we wanted to visit in-depth later or on a future visit. With only 2 days or so, we had to pick and choose our activities. We’d previously visited the Aquarium and the Maryland Science Center, so on this trip we decided to just bum around. I’d read about the highly-rated American Visionary Arts Museum in Federal Hill, and it was definitely worth it. I’ve been to lots of museums all over, and I can honestly say AVAM was one of the coolest – primarily because it is art by people who were not trained as artists. Maybe because I’m a paper crafter I appreciated the work more, but it was an experience – a good one. The museum’s gift shop (Sideshow) is a treasure trove. Sideshow was one of the coolest museum shops with literally tons of stuff. Staff are very friendly and prices were reasonable – from a dollar and up. You cannot take pictures at the museum, which was a bummer. While we were there the primary exhibit was Life Liberty and the Pursuit of Happiness. Some of the exhibits of work by African American artists were particularly moving and impactful. I was particularly awed by the work of Eugene Von Bruenchenhein. His work was so vivid and mind-blowing. If you go (and I suggest you do) stop by the Carnival Mirrors on the top floor. Really cool. I also loved the carving of Lady Liberty made out of driftwood by a Louisiana artist. Once you exit the main building there’s more. There’s a lovely garden with more sculptures and a cool wooden sculpture. Don’t forget to take a picture with the 8 foot glass egg (Cosmic Galaxy Egg by Andrew Logan). Walk past the egg and enter a new exhibit of contemporary art pieces in the James Rouse Visionary Center. I particularly loved the oversize Divine piece by Andrew Logan. I’m not sure this museum is really kid-friendly, because it is so introspective. It’s a thinking-person’s museum not a “watch-the-pretty-picture museum”. Do with that description as you wish. We ate at M&S Grill one time for a late lunch (prompt and attentive service and good food, but a bit pricey). We stopped by the Cheesecake Factory for lunch, got a table, and was ignored by our waiter/waitress for a good 15 minutes. We never saw him or her so we walked out! Life’s too short. For breakfast we ate at Brown Sugar at the mall by the Inner Harbor. They opened early and though service was served with “character” the food was tasty. I had the BLT both days we were there. My husband liked the home fries and the sausage patties so he had that both days. We had dinner one night at Uno. Food was OK. Place was packed so we ate at one of the bar tables. I love seafood and my husband does not so we did not eat at Phillips or any other seafood place. Quite frankly I found the smell at the mall where the Phillips seafood buffet was located to be a bit off-putting. All told, for the convenience of the location, I believe we got good value for what we paid at the Sheraton Inner Harbor. I would not hesitate to stay there again. Please feel free to send me a PM with any additional questions about travel in the DC metro area. Safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but had problem with refund, Inner Harbor - not so nice”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirlmomof4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the inner harbor for a one night stay with out the children to watch the fireworks. The hotel was beautiful and easy to find, parking garage was ok although you had an additional charge of $25.00 on top of the $185.00 stay. I thought that was ridiculous. The staff was friendly and helpful, the bar/restaurant was ok, I think the air was broken in the back, they said they were working on it but we were hot eating our late night snack. All in all the hotel was very nice though, beautiful room, incredible bed that we actually slept until 9:30, that never happens!!! The place was very clean. The Inner Harbor on the other hand was a mess!!! AVOID it on the 4th of July!!! It was mobbed with people and tons of cops, which would normally would make me feel better but I was on edge the entire time. They were patroling from the air too. I never saw so many cops, I kept expecting a building to be blown up or something even worse. I stopped to ask a cop if there was something i should be nervous about and his response was "Yes, you are in one of the most dangerous cities in America" he wasn't joking and i wanted to go home after that. The fireworks were great, really one of the best we have seen yet. We sat with our legs dangling over the bulkhead. This was very nervewracking as the crowd was so huge. I kept thinking we would be the first to be pushed in anything happened. In my opinion the inner harbor has gone downhill since I was there last. I was less then impressed with it. The gallery was nice but so very crowded. I felt like we were totally in the inner city, I was glad my kids were not with me and I will not be taking them to the inner harbor anytime soon. At least during a holiday. Our only complaint about the hotel to speak of was that they charged our card a $50.00 authorization fee for the room then they charged our card TWICE for the room. Once for the hold and once for the stay. All in all our card had over $200.00 just for holding our room. Do not use a debit card to reserve your room. They take a week or more refunding your money AFTER our funds had already been taken out to pay for the room. Be careful with that, they have a sign on the front desk when you sign in but it wasn't clear and didn't mentiont the $50.00 charge also. I would recommend the hotel if you could pick it up and put it somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: vtbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Inner Harbor for a conference. The location was great - close to the O's, Federal Hill and in the midst of the Inner Harbor. The room was clean but left me wishing for more. The shower barely drizzled. The markings on the iron were so worn off that I couldn't be sure of the heat level. I tried multiple settings with no difference noted, added water and then experienced a flood on my clothes. The AC is loud as it comes on and off, as another review mentioned. Not quite the room experience I was hoping for! Internet is $9.95 per day in the room and is per computer. So, if you have a work and personal computer or if you are sharing the room, the cost is for one computer only. After a night out, I came back to my room to discover a crib had been dropped off. A call to the front desk let me know that they were aware of the mistake, but the crib remained throughout the remainder of my stay!! All in all, the hotel may be good for leisure but not so much for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, super friendly & curtious staff!”
Reviews.Author: MAMNorthernNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 2 week stay that was primarily use of a local physical rehabiliation center, remotely working, and taking in the local sites in the evenings for pleasure. The Sheraton Inner Harbor is a great location if you are needing a place that you can walk to just about anywhere, if you need close proximity for any of the local hospital services, or need to do business work remotely. Take advantage of the "green points" to earn green bucks towards a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, but wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Misty58
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent in this hotel, from the smiling porters to housekeeping. No complaints there. There though is a but....for the price of this hotel, not having free wireless seems to be a bit nickel and diming you to death. $10 a day for internet. Yes, it is free in the lobby, but even the Comfort Inn that I had to take on the way down had free internet. The air conditioning in the room was a unit in the room. It would bang on, and bang off. (and no we didn't change rooms, as I was with a conference, and all the rooms were booked). It just barely kept the room cool. We had it set down to 59, and it was by no means cold in the room. Also don't believe the hotel staff if you have to use the phone to call home. One coworker called home for all of 5 minutes (her phone card that she bought did not work) cost $40 (to Canada). Even if you don't reach the person on the other end, it will cost you almost $6. Also parking is going to cost you $24 a day, or for valet $32 per day. Not having a choice but to stay here for the conference and getting a bit of a break on the hotel rate was fine, but I would not knowingly stay here, there are better choices in just as good locations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place To Celebrate Our Engagement!”
Reviews.Author: Monkeyboy239
Reviews.Content: I popped the question to my girlfriend...and I choose the Sheraton as the place where I wanted us to conclude our celebratory night. When I made the reservation, I told them of my plans. When I checked in and gave my name...a gentleman approaced from behind the counter, extending his hand while saying 'congratulations!' He then did some stuff on his computer...and said that he bumped me up to a suite! I was shocked because it was a very busy weekend as the Nationals were in town playing the Orioles and the lobby was packed. But the staff behind the counter went out of their way to make sure our special day was even more special. We also had dinner at Morton's (which is attached to the lobby) and they were just as wonderful there! Highly recommend this hotel for any sort of stay! Nice rooms...comfy beds...great location...and very courteous staff. And if you want to be treat yourself to a very nice dinner...go to Morton's! We couldn't have asked for anythine more!

Reviews.Title: “the s in sheraton could also represent service and smiles and satisfaction, all of which we experienced greatly!”
Reviews.Author: srshultz
Reviews.Content: my title says it all--from personable management to friendly staff, all helped our stay be a fantastic one. we extend special kudos to chuck payne who does a tremendous job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent service but bad gym!"”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBilliken
Reviews.Content: I stay here weekly for business and the location is great. Walking distance to the Inner Harbor, Camden Yards, Federal Hill, Fells Point and downtown Baltimore. The rooms are standard rooms but the service is above average. People really care about helping you have a positive experience. The one complaint is the gym. It is awful. There is 1 treadmill, 1 eliptical and 2 bikes. The space is smaller than a standard room. There are dumbells and a weight machine but it reminds me of the 80's. Overall a pretty good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: RedShoesNottingham
Reviews.Content: Really good location close to the Inner Harbor. Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “For unparalleled service - it's the Sheraton Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Granny55
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, my family and I were treated magnificently, and impeccable service was the norm throughout our stay. The accommodations were superb - our suite was spacious, sumptuous and contained every amenity needed to make our stay comfortable and relaxing. My 2-year-old grandson had a grand time running from room to room exploring every nook and cranny. We ordered room service each day, and our delivery was always accurate, very prompt, and attractively laid out. The hotel's location in Baltimore's Inner Harbor put us right in the midst of all the attractions the city has to offer. I am definitely looking forward to returning again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing From Start to Finish!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren1983_14
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, my husband and I traveled to Baltimore for business meetings as well as to celebrate our wedding anniversary. From start to finish, our time at Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel was completely amazing! We arrived to champagne delivered to our room in honor of our anniversary! We had the most incredibly views of the harbor as well as both stadiums, truly spectacular... Everyone from the front desk staff, to room service, to housekeeping was incredibly warm and friendly. We truly felt that we were taken care of and welcomed! I would recommend a stay at this hotel for anyone looking to come to Baltimore. I cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pillsberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel which offered a fantastic view of the inner harbor, city lights and wonderful attractions located steps away. Everyone was pleasant, courteous and more than willing to accommodate any requests (usually bottled water). I have no problem recommending this hotel to family and friends as a great place to stay if you visit the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “awsome hotel manager -kind, charitable ,concerned about the community”
Reviews.Author: arparrott
Reviews.Content: I had a concern for a family member who had to drive her gr-daughter to outpatient chemotherapy at a local hospital 4 days a week from the Eastern Shore,Maryland to Baltimore. An idea came to me to contact the Sheraton hotel Inner Harbor and ask if they were able to donate a few night stays for my cousin and her gr daughter during the time of the chemo sessions. I was pleased to get a positive response from the hotel manager and that he was able to help them. This helped me to regain faith in humanity and the corporate world. Thank you again to that hotel manager at the Sheraton Inner Harbor. You know who you are.

Reviews.Title: “Great Improvement over the Last Year”
Reviews.Author: Haackman
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Baltimore for the last 8 years for business. I have stayed at several hotels in the Baltimore area. The Sheraton Inner Harbor can’t be beat for location. The hotel is great if you want to see the Baltimore Orioles at Camden Yards (2-blocks away). I do business on the west side of the harbor and have found that staying on the east side of inner harbor is a long walk or a rip-off taxi ride. I have also noticed a definite improvement in the hotel staff in the last year, both at the front desk and the room service. The only drawback is the pay internet in the room. The internet service has been changed from Wayport to ATT which has been an improvement. Internet is free in the lobby area, and computers (4) are provided with printers if you don’t carry a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Baltimore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cantonhorn
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Inner Harbor is very close to most everything Baltimore has to offer. One block from the harbor, it is very near the attractions, eateries and other things to see and do in and around downtown Baltimore. Most everything is within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They jump at every request with a smile. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. I stayed there for almost 9 months and will stay there again if my business or personal travels find me going to Baltimore again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff makes travel easier”
Reviews.Author: MH55555
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the hotel on a number of occasions. Common areas and rooms are fairly modern and in good shape. Hallways are a little run down. Morton's in the lobby is extremely convenient, and hotel food is surprisingly good. Staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome, and are extremely attentive in addressing requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a business traveler!”
Reviews.Author: bpslamda
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel quite often when I am working in Baltimore mostly due to the great service and awesome location. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff is very friendly. The location could not be better, you are in between the inner harbor and the Orioles Park at Camden Yards. Both great places to visit if you get a chance. The only drawback for me is the gym although who needs a gym when you have the best running trail around the harbor just steps away. There is a big hill at the end of the harbor as well which is great for running or biking. Also some great scenery out the windows at this hotel if you are facing either the harbor or the ballpark. I highly recommend going to a ballgame at Camden Yards...one of the cleanest, nicest parks in the country and just a few steps from the hotel. Dont forget that Mortons is in the hotel as well and have a great happy hour twice a day with food that is cheap for a good snack and great drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Comforting, great location”
Reviews.Author: rrpowell
Reviews.Content: My stay at this faclity was great! The staff was accomedating and the location was a few blocks from city center. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Extra friendly service, nice rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lizicat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. The staff working here are very friendly. We got lots of great recommendations for places to eat, and the harbor is a short two blocks away. The rooms are nice and comfortable. I had a great view of the downtown Baltimore area. We used the meeting rooms and had no issues with internet or the A/V systems. The hotel uses Bliss amenities, which are great! No need to bring your own shampoos or soaps. The towel quality varies and the bathroom could have been a bit cleaner though, so only 4 stars on that issue. But, I am surprised about the negative reviews. I would stay here again. The hotel is a $40 cab ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: moviechic8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business and was very please. This Sheraton property is very clean, semi-trendy in design and has a Morton's Steakhouse in the lobby. Rooms were spacious and quiet and the hotel's location is in a good downtown location within walking distance to everything. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: cygnetgirl
Reviews.Content: Good location to the harbor and the convention center. I had reservations about booking this hotel after reading TA reviews, but the extra frequent stay points and location next door to the convention center were too enticing. Have spent over an hour trying to get on their wifi. Have spoken to a minimum of 5 different staff members at the hotel, and no one has an answer. They have recently switched providers and the staff know nothing about the new provider, and are not willing to take the time to either look at the system issue or listen to the customer. Finally resolved to speak to engineering manager. Because it's a Saturday, they will not have an engineering manager in until Monday. Fine room, nice view of the aquarium and harbor, but if you are planning on being productive in your room forget it. It's fine for leisure travelers, but probably too expensive for the average family. If they are targeting the business traveler, they have missed the target by a wide margin.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Inner Harbor was surprisingly very nice.”
Reviews.Author: tagteam123
Reviews.Content: Good location. Literally a short block and a half to the Inner Harbor. Staff incredibly friendly. Rooms comfortable and well appointed. I even think they have the heavenly beds. They are delicious. If you have ever slept in one, you know the difference. The linen too was upgraded, they were crisp, and fresh white clean. I was very surprised to find all this in a Sheraton. Housekeeping did not do a great job cleaning my room. It was very dusty. Good thing I travel with clorox wipes. I choose to clean my room rather than ask to change it. We only ate one meal in the coffee shop, breakfast. It was awful. The eggs and potatoes were horribly greasy. We could not eat it. I told the waiter but it fell on deaf ears. I choose to use self park. It was literally just steps to the front lobby and I felt like my car was safe. Public space was beautiful. They offer complimentary wi-fi in the lobby area and even supply the lap top if you forgot yours. Overall it was a good experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful, beginning with the staff on the front door. I was pleasantly surprised by the name Sheraton. I expected a lot less. I would stay here again. I recommend you try it too.

Reviews.Title: “Professionally Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antarctic
Reviews.Content: I visited Baltimore in 2009 and stayed in the Hyatt, which is the next hotel to the Sheraton and unlike the Sheraton has views of the waterfront. The views of the waterfront are the Hyatt's only bonus - the Sheraton is a far better hotel. I stayed in the Sheraton for a conference. The conference and the hotel arrangements were professionally organised. The rooms were standard US style with a comfortable king size bed, excellent bathroom, widescreen TV. I got a good night's sleep every night I stayed at the Sheraton. The staff were very friendly and keen to assist wherever they could. The food in the Oriels restaurant could do with improving. The breakfast buffet was not good with lots of fat and sugary fare and little in the way of fresh items. The al carte breakfasts were better. The lunches were typical US with large colourful portions with salt and sugar being the primary flavours. I found the food disappointing but I am not fond of US style food which for me is strong on portion size, presentation, fats and sugars but lacking in quality and taste.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed here for a convention this week...”
Reviews.Author: eapicella
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention this week. I had searched nd read many reviews and wasn't sure what I was getting into. First off let me tell you I am very picky so I was worried haven never been to baltimore or seen this place before. It was very nice,clean,updated,nicee beds, complimentary breakfast with starbucks coffee,very pleasant staff. You will not be let down..it was very very very very nice and also connected to the convention center and skywalk that connects to the city stores. 2 downfalls : 1 is tiny pool, 2nd $25 parking. Other than those 2 this place is Perfect just keep your eyes out for a good price, I paid 177 a night which I bet you could find cheaper! Good luck and don't waste your time searching hotels Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ERat
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Inner Harbor is perfectly acceptable for anyone who needs a safe hotel in a great location while in Baltimore. We, a group of 10 guys, travel each winter to Baltimore for a conference and usually stay at this hotel. The service is great, beds are comfortable, bathroom is clean, LCD tv's, great view of M&T Bank Stadium and the warehouse at Camden Yards. It's a very easy walk, via skywalk, to the inner harbor shops and restaurants, it's a quick cab ride to Federal Hill, and it's easy to get to. The staff was very helpful, quick to correct any needs. One night we noticed that there weren't any clean towels left after housekeeping left. I called the front desk and was informed that due to the weather, SNOW!!!, the linen truck was running behind. The towels were delivered when we got back to our room at the end of the day. We walk almost everywhere we go so it's in a great location to visit all of the sights of Baltimore. The hotel is showing a little wear, but every hotel I've ever stayed in has something that can be improved upon. In this case, $30 per night parking but that's the going rate in Baltimore. Overall, it's just fine. Anyone who has a problem with this hotel is just too difficult to please.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer Service & I dont even go till this weekend”
Reviews.Author: MRB15
Reviews.Content: I haven't taken my weekend trip yet, but I'll leave another review after I do. But I just wanted to tell about my great customer service I received before check-in. I was wary about going to Baltimore this weekend with the 70+ inches of snow and the city being shut down. I booked thru Hotels.com and they stated that this hotels cancellation policy is 100% non refundable by today (just had another bad storm yesterday, So I had no way of canceling sooner) They tried contacting the hotel for me and said they didnt answer, so I emailed the hotel found on their site and got the quickest response saying they would fully refund without penalty if we choose to cancel. She told me all about the conditions, how the city was doing with getting the roads cleared and was VERY helpful. I decided to keep my trip on for this weekend and I am already looking forward to my stay if this hotel treats all their customers this good. She didn't talk to me like a robot with an automated response, she talked to me like a real person and was very quick about responding, I am VERY satisfied!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and small”
Reviews.Author: blong8082
Reviews.Content: The hotel and pool were very nice. Parking was an extra $30 per day and this was not included in the hotel price. With this included I would have picked a nicer hotel with free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Letgo7
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband and 3 year old son to Baltimore to go to the Aquarium. I was concerend after reading Trip Advisor but my fears were put to rest when we arrived. We had room 1004 which had a beautiful view of the Inner Harbor. Our room was very clean and the hotel was in a perfect location. We took the train from Richmond to Baltimore and it was a short $8.00 cab ride to the hotel. The front door staff and front desk were very friendly. I did have a unique circumstance which leads me to one of my two criticisms. My son became very ill and I called the front desk to ask the following questoins: Where is the closest Target? Ellen had no idea. Where is the closest 24 hour pharnmacy? Ellen had no idea. Is there a laundrymat close by that is open? Ellen had no idea. So, if you are traveling with small children and want to know the answers, here they are...There is a Target within 10 mins of downtown Baltimore, there is a 24 hour Rite Aid in town at Charles and Light and there is a laundrymat at the top of the hill on Broadway that stays open until midnight. Ellen did make some calls for me but I had to find out some information on my own. I invite Ellen to transfer guests to someone who actually knows Baltimore or to get educated. The housekeeping staff was amazing. Without going into any detail, I needed to get more towels, washcloths and a new comforter. The person they sent to my room was incredible. She was less concerned about their linens and more concerned about my son. My only other issue was the room service prices are absolutely ridiculous. Cereal is $17.00! Are you kidding me? We ordered a waffle, an American breakfast (2 eggs, sausage, potatoes, toast and juice and coffee, a diet Pepsi and an apple juice for our son and it was over $60.00! Also, when our son was sick we had to eat in so my husband went to the Orioles Grill and ordered a 12" pizza and brought back 4 beers and that too was almost $60.00. I want everyone to know I would stay at this hotel again and I would recommend it to friends but I am hopeful that Chuck (Hotel Manager) will read this and work with Ellen on better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Snowy Getaway”
Reviews.Author: markmarietyler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled from DC to Baltimore in order to take our young son to the Baltimore Aquarium the next morning. Little did we know we'd be snowed in the next two days and the Aquarium would remain closed the entire visit. My appreciation of the staff at the Sheraton Inner Harbor cannot be expressed in words. Not only were our expectations met they were exceeded tremendously. The visit with Santa topped off the weekend. Had it not been for the great staff our son would have been stir crazy.

Reviews.Title: “High Value”
Reviews.Author: francoisdaman
Reviews.Content: Checkin was smooth, room was clean , high def TV, king bed was comfortable, had a semi harbor view. You have to walk about 2-3 blocks to the action of the Harbor, but considering how service at the Harbor has gone downhill, I wouldn't say that's the best reason to visit Baltimore if you are kid free anyway...considering the price relative to being in the harbor, the Inner Harbor Sheraton is fantastic. Now the pool is more like an oversized Jacuzzi ( its very small ), the fitness room was average ( definitely better than the pool ). A few insider tips....do breakfast at the Hyatt across the street, the atmoshere there is far better than Oriole Grille in the Sherton. Park 1-2 blocks opposite direction of Harbor, away from the hotel ( stay on Charles Street ), and you'll get a much better parking rate ( save about $10 / day ) .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMikePlano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just three short blocks, 5 minutes, from the Inner Harbor. Valet parking is available as well as self park. But the difference is just $8 a day ($20 versus $28) that the convenience is worth it. The room was spacious and well appointed. While we did not eat at the hotel, what with all the great restaurants in the area, we did look at the menus and found them very good and reasonably priced. Check-In and out were fast and convenient. The room was very quiet and the A/C was excellent, even if it wasn't that necessary. The prime factor for picking this hotel was closeness to the harbor and secondary was the price, which was under $125 due to a sale Sheraton was having. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Other reviews a little too harsh...”
Reviews.Author: CityLover766
Reviews.Content: My husband, who NEVER uses Trip Advisor booked this hotel for our weekend getaway trip. I, who ALWAYS use Trip Advisor was worried. I saw the reviews and was certain we were going to be forfeting our $200 and looking somewhere else to stay. I was pleasantly surprised. This is a nice place. Yes, this hotel is not the Wynn Las Vegas with gilded marble floors and champagne fountains. So, if you're a high roller this hotel may be too low brow for you. My husband and I are not high rollers, but we do enjoy the good life and think this place is great. Hotel Pros: 1. We were in room 1108. The room was clean, nicely equipped, and had absolutely fantastic views. The headboard was crooked. That's the only negative. 2. Outstanding staff. We checked in early, and our original room was not ready. Latoya at the front desk researched it and got us into a new room right away. She did this unsolicted - a high point. 3. We paid a special rate of $99 a night. I would say that our room and experience was worth $150 a night. 4. The location is fantastic. If you're not leaving Baltimore Inner Harbor, no need to rent a car. Enterprise right in hotel if you want to go somewhere. 5. The front desk staff was extremely attentive, helpful, and genuinely happy to help you. As were all the fellas at the front ready to open doors at a moment's notice. With a smile, at that. Cons: 1. A little loud, if you happen to have youngsters using the stairwell next to your room to get to/fro their friends rooms after they've been drinking for 6 hours straight and need to shout at each other to be heard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very run down!”
Reviews.Author: BFLOMAN
Reviews.Content: During recent stay for a meeting that was being held at this hotel I found the property very run down. The worst of it is the hotel has a critter problem...Bugs and mice! The meeting room had nats flying around, one of my co-workers had bugs in the carpet in his room. Another co-worker had to have her room moved because a mouse was in the room. No critters in my room but I was on the top floor. It seemed like the whole place needed a good scrubbing. Stay at the Hyatt, Intercontinental or new Hilton right by the ballpark instead. They are right in the same area

Reviews.Title: “Felt Deceived”
Reviews.Author: twonice2e
Reviews.Content: We had booked our stay at the Sheraton a couple months in advance. paying $177 a night for two nights. I was led to believe we were getting a view of Camden yards. Figuring it would be nice view for my 10 year old baseball loving son. Upon going to our room(532), and looking out the window, we observed the verizon building and the Hyatt hotel, no stadium view as advertised. Thinking it was a mistake, I went down to the front desk and inquired about the room. The lady at the desk, asked our room number, and then advised that we did have a room with a stadium view, but that we wouldn't be able to look into the park. Maybe she is paid to say that. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: tuam123
Reviews.Content: For the money I spent at this hotel I would not stay here again. When I booked the hotel I asked for a room with a great view of the harbor as this was a special event. They called the room a "harbor view" and if you did stand at the edge of the window and look all the way to the right you could see the harbor! They told me I would get a very good room and the room was located next to the ice room which you heard all night making ice and people going in and out of the room! When I booked the room I asked about parking and was told that they would include parking in the rate quoted, when I arrived I was told the rate was $32.00 for valet and they knew nothing about parking being included! When I inquired in the morning where I could get a newspaper I was told to walk 2 blocks to a store, now thats service! When asked if coffee was available I was told to go to the 2nd floor restaurant, when I got there the restaurant was not open yet, I guess they forgot to mention that part to me. Internet was not available in the rooms for free and when I tried to log on I was not able to, I went to the desk and was told that it was not part of the hotel, it was an outside company, with no additional help being offered? I was told I could use the computer in the lobby, not quite what I had in mind. The hotel is in a great location in the Inner Harbor and very close to Camden Yards, however with the amount of hotels in the area I would suggest trying a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: mel4trip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for my birthday for a weekend last April. The room was very clean, especially considering that we stayed in a dog friendly room. We loved the dark blue decorating scheme of the room and the bed was very comfortable. We had a view of both the harbor and the baseball stadium. The location is key as it is in walking distance to the Harbor and to the Baseball field. Some negatives were the small pool and gym. The restaurant was decent but moderately-overpriced. Overall, we really enjoyed it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel- but not if you must workout or go swiming”
Reviews.Author: Eyeluvpets
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for what we needed it to be. Location was Great, it is one block from the very popular Inner Harbor. The room was good, a lot nicer than I thought it would be. Flat Screen TV, makeup mirror, full size standing mirror, two chairs, amenities are from the popular company "Bliss". The hotel has a free business center. All you need is your room number and last name and you get free access!! Also free colored printer. There is a Morton's Stake House attached to the hotel. The only bad thing I can say, is the fitness center was horrendous!! If you are someone who likes to work out/needs to work out- DO NOT STAY HERE. You will be very unhappy. The fitness room was smaller than my hotel room. The machines must be from the late 80's early 90's. A fitness room at a Motel 8 would be better than this one (if motel's have fitness rooms that is??). The pool was also horrible. Its great for kids, but that is it. It was tiny and could not fit more than 6-7 kids in it at a time. No adult could be in there. If you do not care about working out or going for a swim, the hotel is great. If you do care about those two things- go somewhere else! You can contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: ImpatientTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have always had good luck with Sheraton Hotels but this one had some problems. The double beds were made with queen or king size sheets and by morning the sheets were untucked and the bed was not "Heavenly." The staff was not friendly. The location was good and the maid service was extraordinarily good -- chocolates on pillow every night and complimentary bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “not like any sheraton hotel i have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: airUk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many sheraton hotels around the world and to say this hotel is poor is an understatement. Around 11.30 in the evening i was woken by lots of noise outside my door,when i looked out to see what was going on they was a lady walking her two dogs up and down the hallway. Later on i was woken again by the noise of dogs barking in the room next to me,i called down to the front desk to complain and was told they would send somebody up to sort it out.30 mins later the barking was still going on.In the end i had to move rooms at 1.30am. the next day at the front desk i was informed that the hotel allows dogs into the rooms,when i asked how do the hotel stop any fleas or ticks from dogs in the rooms i was informed that the hotel has no policy. MAKE YOUR OWN CHOCE MINE IS NEVER TO STAY THERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Aurora09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two children (3 and 2) here and stayed 2 nights last week. Location With 2 little kids, close proximity to the inner harbor is an important consideration. The hotel is one block from the inner harbor. When the weather is nice, it is quite a pleasant walk along the harbor. The temperature in those April days had reached 90, and my 3 year old refused to walk during the day. So, even though we are less than half a mile to the aquarium, we have to cab it. We did enjoy the aquarium. On weekends, it gets busy, and you need to buy tickets in advance. But, we visited on a Monday, we could enter the aquarium right away. We also got a hand stamp, so the kids could come back later in the day and visit again. Room When we arrived, there was a shirt (someone else's) hanging in the closet. Although the shirt seemed to have been cleaned and pressed, it was still rather annoying. Other than that, the room is fairly clean. I agree with some of the other reviews that the sound insulation was pretty bad. We could hear the sounds of TV from next door. Had we gotten a room with a harbor view, I would probably feel much better about this place. But we were told that there were no more harbor view rooms with 2 double beds. Service The day we were leaving Baltimore, the city had a major water break. And when we woke up in the morning, the water looked brown. The staff did a good job, placing cases of poland spring on each floor. Food We had lunched once at the Orioles Grill. The food was not bad, but pricy. Summary The location is excellent. The service is good. The lobby could use some update.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh...”
Reviews.Author: sandollar82
Reviews.Content: Not much to say about this one. Stayed for Valentine's Day two years ago and wasn't too impressed. As everyone else has mentioned, parking fees are horrible (I guess I should have expected this in the Inner Harbor), staff not very helpful, okay dinner at Morton's...not too bad but certainly nothing to brag about. City view outside window was pretty cool. Probably won't return unless absolutely necessary!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not as upscale as they imply.”
Reviews.Author: Dee1Dee
Reviews.Content: For the location and the advertising I expected this to be a more upscale hotel. Some of the amenities were upscale, like the bellhops, valets, the plasma tv, the $20.00 cost to park. We attended a private function and the drinks and buffet were excellent. The staff at the function were all very friendly and accomadating. Like other reviewers, the hotel could use a good redecorating, the lobby is dated and the carpeting throughout the hotel, including the room should be replaced. We also; like someone else mentioned; felt there was a gap in the wall near the window, we could hear the tv from the other room. The window was not very well insulated, it was raining and snowing and the inside of the window and the window sill were all wet. The room was clean enough but the bed was hard. I prefer the pillow top mattresses that the Hilton and Marriot chains provide. The sheets were also not as nice as the Hilton or the Marriot. The room and the bathroom were small, but in the city that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: ndmba03
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to begin with this hotel. It came recommended, but I will never stay there again. Just a few of the problems from room 933; 1. The wireless connection was so bad, I had to sign-up on the Hyatt's network, which is across the street! 2. The cable TV was great on maybe two channels. One channel didn't even have sound. The majority of the channels was like watching through a snow storm. 3. The room only had one night stand next to the bed. 4. Speaking of the bed, the sheets didn't fit, so halfway through the night you wake up on the mattress. 5. The airconditioner compressor was so loud, it was like sleeping next to an idling Kenworth Truck. 6. There is no sound insulation anywhere, so you could hear people coming and going all night long. 7. The front desk was very slow. We waited forever to get a second key. Avoid this hotel. It is in dire need of a complete renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great view”
Reviews.Author: JRF07
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a business trip. In all, a nice hotel, mostly depending on the room and it’s location on the Inner Harbor. I was a little wary when I arrived, since the entrance to the Lobby looked a little dated. The front desk staff lacked personality, but were competent. I received a room upgrade, and wound up with a very nice view of the Harbor. The room was clean and fairly modern and roomy, with a nice, large plasma TV. The one complaint I had was that there was a gap between the connecting room near the window, so I could hear my neighbor until he left for the evening (he, apparently, was not there for business). If you go, try to get a water view.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel, PERFECT location!!”
Reviews.Author: michele214
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT hotel in a PERFECT location. The hotel is located only 2 blocks from Camden Yards & 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor. All of the rooms have been recently updated with NEW furniture, a flat screen TV & modern decor. The hotel does offer on site covered parking for a $22 self park fee. The hotel also has an indoor pool and several restaurants including a Morton's Steakhouse. My family & I stayed 2 nights in August to attend a Orioles/Yankees game. It was the perfect hotel for us as the location can not be beat. We would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to be close to everything but does not want to pay $300+ a night for the upscale hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay”
Reviews.Author: tchr94
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location. Not overly upscale, but offered plenty. Who travels to spend time in their room? As long as it is clean and comfortable, we're happy. I did not go to Baltimore to spend more than necessary time in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lv4outdoor
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, not a stellar hotel. Stayed here for three nights when I had an event at the Convention Center. Good things: Location is very good. Only a couple blocks from the inner harbor, and only a couple of blocks the other way to Camden Yards and the light rail station. Rooms are clean and upgraded, at least in terms of the TV and bathrooms. All the staff we ran into were nice, so no problems there. We had no problems with gurgling plumbing at all. Not so good things: It really is only the best location if you have an event in the east portion of the Convention Center. Even then, the Hyatt is only a couple hundred feet further away. If your event is in the west portion of the Center, the Days Inn or Hilton are closer. Those hotels are also closer to Camden Yards. If you want a hotel even closer to the Inner Harbor, check out the Renaissance or the Hyatt. As everyone has said, self-parking is $22, but you'll want to check the other hotels, they might charge for parking as well. The bed in the room was pretty sad - thin and pretty hard mattress. As people have said also, the walls are paper thin, so you can hear other rooms pretty well. People around us were pretty quiet though. Also, the A/C works very well, but it is pretty loud when it turns on and off (louder than other hotel units). Anyway, not a bad hotel overall, but I'd only book it if you can find a better rate here than another hotel in the inner harbor area..

Reviews.Title: “Off to Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: Ned14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night when we went to an Orioles game. Very nice hotel, room was gorgeous, although pricey. Drawback is $22 self parking charge. I knew about it, but wanted to stay close to the park. $30 charge for valet parking. The other downer was trying to find a bagel shop for breakfast. Nothing in the area open on a Sunday morning. Had to eat in the hotel and its not cheap Wandered down to the inner harbor, they have done a really nice job here. But it was really hot, so it was tough to linger. If you want to stay close to the park, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: denisenyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend over July 4th weekend. This review may be biased due to the fact that there was a big convention/reunion at the hotel with hundreds of young adults---which I don't think the hotel's staff managed very well. Throughout the weekend, we had to push through crowds to get to the elevators---which by Saturday night weren't working properly. Sunday morning when we were leaving, there were cups on the elevator floor, and empty champagne bottles on tables in the lobby . We also had an incident with our neighbor---again, not the hotel's fault, but I don't think they handled it in the best possible way. Our first night there, our neighbors had an argument and the guy stormed out only to return at 3am and start banging on the door, and ultimately kicking in the wall next to the door. We called security but I honestly don't think they ever arrived. Due to the large volume of people at the hotel, we must have seen 10 people wearing t-shirts that said Security, so unless they were overwhelmed with other complaints (which was possible) there should have been no reason they didn't come up. We complained to the manager on duty the next morning and she said that it was being handled at a higher level---in my opinion, they should have thrown him out---there was substantial damage to the wall, so they had every right. I was worried the rest of the weekend that there were would be a repeat performance, and considered asking to move rooms, but other than some occasional shouting, they behaved. Also, we were staying on the Club Level, and you don't expect this type of behavior there. By Saturday, several of the elevators weren't working at all, and the ones that were stopped at every floor---where there were crowds of partying people waiting to get on. I have to say when we did make it to our floor, it was like an oasis of calm compared to the other floors---even with the rowdy neighbors. Our room was fine---comfy king-sized bed, flat screen TV, nice bath amenities, and a great view of Camden Yards----going to an Oriole game was the highlight of the weekend. I wasn't really impressed with the Inner Harbor or the restaurants there. We planned on going to Fell's Point to eat, but for various reasons didn't get there. While it is always good to get away, this trip definitely won't rank in our top 10.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Accomodations at a Five Star Price”
Reviews.Author: mkent924
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel located on South Charles St. immediately adjacent to the Baltimore Inner Harbor offers comfortable, spacious rooms with above average service. The hotel has two restaurants on site, the Oriole Grill and Morton's Steakhouse, the latter a somewhat pricey replica of Ruth Chris'. The rooms are exceptionally clean, modern and well done, offering excellent views of Camden Yards, the City, and the Inner Harbor. There is plenty of of room to sprawl out and get comfortable. The indoor pool is tiny, and suffers from an excess of chlorine that will burn and redden your eyes. However, at $300 a night, you must remember you are in Baltimore, and not New York, San Francisco, or Paris. The Hotel is grossly overpriced, plus a $22 per day parking fee, and you really would do better to stay elsewhere and invest the dollars saved eating some Maryland Seafood. I would return, but not at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “My service was great!”
Reviews.Author: PittFam
Reviews.Content: I saw some of the previous reviews in regards to receiving bad service and I must say our experience was the total opposite. From the moment I called to confirm our reservations until the moment we left we received excellent service. All staff members were extremely courteous. We were traveling with an infant so it could be quite difficult. But the staff went out of their way to assist us with what ever we needed. The room itself was nice. It was a little above average. We had a nice view of the harbor. The hotel is conveniently located to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel for any future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: jp5o
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time or money Poor staff service and mediocre lunch restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: harrellz3
Reviews.Content: The price is comparable to other Inner Harbor hotels. The price would indicate good service and great rooms. Not here! The airconditioner did not work......room was absolutely miserable with heat and humidity. The call to guest services never produced any response even though we were told a repair would be made. The faucets dripped. The TV was connected to a wall outlet across the room by a heavy duty orange electrical cord. Every possible amenity was an extra and outrageous charge. The icemaker on our floor was out of order the entire stay. The lobby was very nice but the rooms were shabby and poorly maintained. The staff was generally aloof and acted as if assisting a guest was an imposition. Avoid this hotel if possible.

Reviews.Title: “could definately be better, could definately be worse”
Reviews.Author: jenelissa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a wedding, which made the weekend exciting and memorable. the hotel is super close to the harbor which is great and we really enjoyed the view of Camden Yards and Baltimore. However, our air conditioner made a loud noise and we asked if it could be fixed and they said "just wait, it will stop"... yeah... never stopped. The walls are paper thin, we heard everyone and quite small. we got a reduced rate for the wedding. i would never stay here and pay the full amount.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: HermaninHercules
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because I attended a conference in the same hotel. Rooms are noisy, you can hear the neighbors tv or even conversation. Airco is noisy too. Personnel was inattentive, maybe because guests were committed to the hotel anyway due to the conference. All in all this is the prototypical large chain experience, where in their search for profits hotel chains employ very young, disinterested, badly schooled people, who are drilled to suggest they are interested but in fact do not give a damn about your queries on how to get to A or B or why the pool is not open at 6 despite a sign saying so and repeated confirmations that indeed yes it will be next morning, but oh no sorry, only at 6.30 today.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Whatsoever!”
Reviews.Author: spookycatofphilly
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this Sheraton. Great location to camden yards... has a path to the inner harbor. Great location, great staff. Rooms were clean and comfortable. I would recommend this to anyone. I know the average stay is on the pricey side... I went through priceline and got a bargain which may be why my expectations were exceeded. Downfalls were... self-parking was 22$ a day (I am sure all hotels by the inner harbor are at least that) and interent hook up was 10$ for 12 hours. Had I paid full price for the hotel.. these things would have bothered me. We actually ended up leaving a night early because of a family emergency and left some shirts in the closet which they are sending to us. Very, very accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: phantomtruck
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. The main entrance was nice and well attended by staff, but the garage entrance was vacant and dirty. Room (standard queen on 12th) was decent size, not large by any means, with good view of stadiums (view of harbor from other side of hotel). Room had a pass through door to the next room and was transparent to sound. Could hear everything next door. Not good it you are a light sleeper. Staff was courteous and efficient. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay”
Reviews.Author: Joanie881
Reviews.Content: I had no problems at all with this hotel. Huge lobby looked kind of impressive, nice people checking in altho there was confusion when my friend came a day later even tho I'd left a key for him. And his sliders from the Oriole's Cafe weren't very good. But you could always get something from Morton's (including free steak sandwiches in the evening). I didn't ask for any extras (except for a lotion) so can't comment on internet, etc. The basic room was comfy and location was good, but a bit of a walk to the Mt. Vernon and Fells Point sections. Which didn't bother me since I walk everywhere. Was surprised I got it for $72 on Amazing Bargains/Priceline when the Ravens were in town, a bargain and a half.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gahlisary
Reviews.Content: Came down to Baltimore with the girlfriend for a wedding at the Hyatt next door. We liked the Sheraton. Like most Sheratons we've noticed, this is a well-located hotel but is a little old and while partially renovated, a little rough around the edges. Great location, a block from the water, near Fed Hill, Camden Yards, and the downtown shops and bars. Very easy to find, high-profile hotel. Lobby was fine, could use a little freshening, but not unattractive. Service was good, no line, and friendly check-in agent. Guestroom hallways looked new and stylish and the guestrooms themselves were in great shape. Attracive-looking bed, large flatscreen tv, stylish richly-colored walls and wallpaper. Furntiure fine, but black leather desk chair had seen better days. Hotel bathroom looked old but was of decent size and had curved shower rod and strong water pressure. Hotel had a small indoor pool and a sauna off the pool's bathroom. Sauna was nice and clean and a great feature, but the attached bathroom needs a freshening. Hotel bar, Orioles Grille, was pretty good, didnt eat, just had a few drinks before the wedding. A little small and the bar area doesn't face a window, but its been nicely decorated as an upscale sports bar. Didnt use the business center, didnt notice if there was wifi or how much. Self parking was $20/night. No major complaints, we would def come back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: Rob Mossack
Reviews.Content: Ok, there have been plenty of terrible reviews on this property. Come on, people, what are you expecting? When you stay at a property that was built back in the 80's (or whenever), it's going to LOOK like a property from that era. I stayed for almost a week during a conference, and my experience was ok. Granted, this isn't the best place I've ever stayed, but the staff was VERY friendly and helpful, and my room was clean--and plenty big enough. You can't beat the location--one block to Camden Yards, and a block the other direction right into the Inner Harbor area. I paid about $190/nt. conference rate, and I do agree with those who say it's way overpriced for the level of comfort. However, if you travel at all to larger cities, you find that's now the norm. I would recommend a stay here if you get a really cheap rate on one of the travel sites...but don't pay full rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: eromitlabhitw
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. It's a two-block walk to light rail and the stadiums, two blocks in the other direction to Inner Harbor and Pratt Street and the convention center less than a block away. The staff is friendly and helpful. There are a few loose ends in the rooms; mine was a bit on the small side and the furnishings seemed crammed in too tightly, the carpet was coming up on the edges near the desk and the closet door was off its track but opened just fine. The bed was a little harder than I would have liked, but I slept more comfortably on it than I usually do on a hotel bed. The standard room rates are a bit much, but you can't go wrong staying here if you catch a deal. There are a number of new hotels going up soon in downtown Baltimore, and the competition may help to knock prices down in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay through AA Vacations and got an awesome rate!!! After reading several negative reviews, we were skeptical about staying here.......glad we did! :) About the rooms.....no, they are nothing to write home about, but they were average. Air conditioner was not too terribly loud and plumbing was not an issue for us. Did not find the walls to be too thin....I never heard another's conversation. The only thing I heard outside my room was an occasional slamming of a door. I think that will be heard at almost any hotel. You cannot beat the location. Excellent! Especially if you plan on Inner Harbor activities or Camden Yards. Did not dine at the hotel as there were so many options on the harbor and Little Italy. (Little Italy is a must by the way!!! We ate at Chaperellis (sp?) and it was great...we ate a Canoli at Vaccaro's and those are to die for!!!!) The staff was ok. They want 1.50 to make a toll free call. A little ridiculous in my opinion. Upon check out it was rather lengthy because the agent couldnt get the printer to work.... We would probably return if I could get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Ohhhhh....kay”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: I used to come to Baltimore fairly regularly and always had terrific stays at this hotel. My last visit was in '98 and it's showing it's age. The basic's, like scrubbing handprints off elevator walls, and sloppily glued on "floor number" plates are not basic. The room was nice. Top floor. But not a $350 a night room. The concierge lounge was good. GREAT staff. The Orioles Grill got one attempt by me. The meatballs in my spaghetti were still frozen on the inside. But if you want a great $43 steak, Morton's is connected. I like the convenience of blasting in on 95 and BOOM, being right in the garage after a hasty U turn. But it's not the moderately swanky property that I remember.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one!”
Reviews.Author: JCV303
Reviews.Content: A totally undistinguished hotel. Want internet access? Cough up $10 per day. Want a fridge? Add another $20 per day. Want Styrofoam coffee cups (or more than one day of coffee in room)? Forget it. Try getting help from the concierge or front desk? Hopeless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamma3
Reviews.Content: Read reviews that were not so good and was concerned....BUT...I liked the hotel...clean rooms..friendly staff..the walls were thin but what hotel doesn't have thin walls...you have full control of room temperature...you are within walking distance of Camden Yards..Innerharbor etc..so park the car in the hotel garage for 20.00 a day and avoid the traffic...used priceline and got room CHEAP!!

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay At The Sheraton Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: knoelleb
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation for the Sheraton Inner Harbor online and couldn't wait to see the hotel and all the beautiful sites that were listed. Sometimes I'm skeptical, however everything was just as it was written on the website. Upon entering the hotel, I was immediately greeted by a wonderful bellman with a huge warm smile and the excellent service didn't end there. The front desk staff was very friendly along with the concierge who was very helpful in touring the city. I was very impressed with the decor of the hotel and the rooms. They were very clean and I absolutely loved the bed. The Oriole's Grille had excellent food (I suggest the crabcakes!) and the service was wonderful. Every staff member I came in contact with was very friendly and outgoing and made it a point to make me feel welcomed throughout my entire stay. If you ever need or want to travel to Baltimore, I highly suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but don't expect plush interiors”
Reviews.Author: iyleema
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Inner Harbor for 8 nights on a business trip. The location is perfect - short walk to the harbor, restaurants, shopping, and to both of my client buildings. The hotel needs an update terribly. The carpet is worn and bathroom is old. The house-keeping service can also use some improvements. I received 8 days of inconsistent service. I had to leave a note to have the room and bathroom vacuumed. A/C provided nightly water-fall sounds - it actually became very soothing. Plumbing needs update. I had stayed at the Sheraton City Center several times and thought the rooms were fantastic - completely newly renovated. But the location was somewhat inconvenient. If you're looking for a great location with access to everything, this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A NICE GETAWAY!! NOISY NOISY HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: MELS16
Reviews.Content: Well, the front desk was a breeeeze. They made getting into the room an easy swift process. However we could use some more smiles people! IT was a nice sunny warm afternoon, where were the smiles,....not sure. ANYWAY! We got to the room and unfortunately the sink was CLOGGED! I mean can i wash my hands after driving from NYC all morning. SO we had to wash our hands and then hurry and turn off the water. we told them to come fix it or SWITCH ROOMS ASAP. So we went down to the Orioles restuarant and had a meal that was mediocre at best. The Orioles game was on and it was liek pulling teeth to get the waiter's attention from THAT TV! Prices were not so bad though. We got back to the room and the sink was fixed, but GLUB GLUB GLUB all night long! (who fixed it Santa Claus??) Anyway, we ordered a movie and relaxed, but I think we were in a college dorm! WE HEARD EVRYTHING from both sides of our room! Super thin walls!! SUPER THIN! I cant see how this is a 4 star hotel? I styed there April 21st as birthday Harbor getaway for my newly married husband. Well, he said things were fine, but well I wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: hadogenes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights during a conference. The staff were very helpful, the beds were comfortable, and the rooms clean. HOWEVER, the walls seemed to be extremely thin, with a lot of noise from the roads and adjacent rooms. Furthermore, the pipes in the bathroom gurgled noisily throughout the night, and the heat/air was very loud. The pool is truly tiny, there really is not much to the lobby, and the "Orioles" restaurant is only mediocre. I spent quite a bit of time with colleagues in the beautiful lobby and restaurant of the neighboring Hyatt Hotel. In short: don't sacrifice sleep for a bargain--avoid this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Sinks go glug glug all night long”
Reviews.Author: Skinnywater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a car show on account of a room block with the company I work for at the Car Show. The sink went glug, glug, all night long. The rooms were dirty, and housekeeping lax. No extra toilet paper, bad heating, poor ventilation. I ordered breakfast one morning at the restaurant, $18.00 for two eggs and bacon, come on! I could hardly understand my waiter, the staff was busy watching Super Bowl recaps that morning. This place is nasty, find another hotel. All the high prices without the high quality. Does anyone from this property read these reviews? Yuk, never again. And stay away from a place called "the Wharf Rat", got bad food poisoning from the fish and chips, about died!

Reviews.Title: “So disgusting and dirtly, I left early”
Reviews.Author: raku8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and the room was so disgusting that I, and one other person attending the same meeting as I (we were in separate rooms and had similar experiences), checked out early, and moved to another hotel in the Inner Harbor area. The bathroom was filthy. There was no toilet paper in the holder. I later found the roll placed on the back of the tank. Yeah, maids, you may live like this at home, but please, I don't. The tub was had a ring of dirt around it. The carpet was disgusting and coated with dirt and looked like they just brought the vacuum in for a visit but didn't actually turn it on. I guess they' re saving energy. The worst part was the smell. I had a non-smoking room that smelled like a Vegas casino, embedded with alcohol and cigarettes. The bedspread likely hadn't been cleaned in, well, forever. The walls outside every room had room service trays, some that stayed for days. Can you say ants? cockroaches? mice? I hardly slept at night with the smell and dust. I couldn't leave soon enough and I will never be back. Needless to say, I do not recommend the Sheraton Inner Harbor to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “easy for walking around”
Reviews.Author: usaagain
