Reviews.Content: A great welcome when i signed in. The room was great over looking the Baseball ground. The food was great. Also the location to the Harbour. Great to see the old warship. Do not miss there railroad musium so many old trains. you get a great view from the WTC. I did enjoy the harbout area for all the various Sea Foods

Reviews.Title: “better off to go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: traveler54321
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in the Inner Harbor area, you can do much, much better than this Sheraton. Our room was next to the elevator, and the amount of noise each time the elevator passed our floor was unbelievable. This noise was nearly constant from 6 a.m. to midnight. We should have asked for another room (if one had been available), but we were on a tight schedule when we checked in. Our room was clean and reasonably comfortable but quite barebones in amenities. The wireless feature (for which you pay extra, of course) would not work, and the hotel provided zero assistance. (We had to pay a dollar to make the toll-free call to the internet provider to cancel our subscription.) The TV set had an out-of-focus picture. Worst of all, there are essentially NO rooms with a good view of the Inner Harbor. How can this be when you are one block away? The hotel was built at a bad angle, undoubtedly to maximize the number of rooms. People stay here for conventions and for conferences booked at the hotel. Do yourself a favor and stay a block or two further away.

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping problems.”
Reviews.Author: johnk123
Reviews.Content: Good stay overall. Attending a convention, and hotel was VERY convient to the baltimore convention center (probably the closest). houskeeping didnt change the sheets any of the 5 nights we were there. I was not happy about this. Im all for saving the enviorment, and the such, but I should have the choice to reuse my sheets if I CHOOSE. The hotel SHOULD not make this decision for me. the sink made "glug glug" sounds as it was not vented properly. Most everything else was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Wait To Leave the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: thelibster
Reviews.Content: We booked 1 night at the Sheraton as we were having dinner and were celebrating downtown. We chose the hotel primarily for its location and through for $225/night it would be pretty decent - WRONG! We pulled up to the hotel to check in and pulled in behind other cars in the driveway area in front of the hotel. My husband and I each grabbed our rolling bags and went into the hotel to check-in. Halfway into the lobby, 3 guys working at the hotel told us we needed to move our car, we indicated we were checking in and that we would move the car after we checked in but they insisted we move the car NOW. Which we did but didn't see the point in this as we were not blocking anyone, in fact, we were the ONLY car in the check-in drive. So, I went back outside and moved my car up about 10 feet - totally pointless. On to check in - the guy who checked us in was rude and confused - we wanted to check out with another card instead of the one on file and this caused mass confusion. The other people working the front desk were also rude and were having personal conversations and joking - just not professional. We checked in and went up to the room, of course, no one asked if we needed help with our bags so we just took them up ourselves. The room was, in a word, gross. The bed literally had a huge sinkhole in the middle of it - so much for a dream bed. The comforter had 'gunk' on it. The AC unit was loud and uncontrollable. There was no room safe nor could you lock the door. The towels smelled like fried food and cigarettes. To top it all off, no hot water, that's right, no hot water. We let the water run for about 5 minutes for our showers but it remained cold - needless to say it was a quick shower. When we came back later and tried to wash our face & brush our teeth - still no hot water. Getting a good sleep was impossible as the bed was caved in the middle like a sinkhole and the loud AC unit would start up every 5 minutes and we would jump thinking someone was breaking into our room, since there was no lock on the door. We almost just left in the middle of the night around 3am but decided to stay and sleep when we got home the next day. Check out was just as checking in, mass confusion. No one offered to help with luggage, nothing. Plus, no one even asked how the stay was. I could go on and on but the point is - don't waste your money. I'm a Baltimore native and am embarrassed that anyone who stays here thinks the hotel is a reflection of Baltimore. There are better hotels than this in Baltimore that are clean, friendly and reasonable. The best part was leaving the hotel and getting to our car - would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff that needs a lesson in cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Callaway99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baltimore Sheraton Inner Harbor for three days while attending a conference hosted at the hotel in August, 2006. Paid a special conference rate of about $160/night plus tax. The GOOD: The beds are amazingly comfortable. I can't recall if I'd heard about Sheraton's reputation for comfy beds but I wanted to buy one for my home (if it were clean ... more later). Staff was friendly, and had to be during a massive heat wave dealing with a lot of business and tourist guests who were spending a lot of time in the the hotel, rather than venture out to the nearby Inner Harbor or Camden Yards attractions. The location to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards can't be beat. My room had all the amenities I needed, but the cable TV channels were very limited to about 8 very basic channels. Wireless Internet cost $10 a day but the speed was good so I didn't mind paying. I didn't use the pool, but I used the gym every day and it was staffed by a very attentive gentleman who changed the TV channel and provided clean towels. The BAD: My room was dirty and smelled like a combination of stale beer and cigar smoke. And, yes, it was a non-smoking room. There were big dust bunnies behind the and on the sides of the beds, around the tables, in the closet. Everytime the A/C came on, dust billowed out. I ended up taking a towel and wiping the grime off the vent slats myself. The smell was so bad, it kept me up at night. On Day 2 when the maids came in, they actually left me a half-used toilet paper roll on the bathroom counter. Nice! It looked like they ran the vacuum once down the center of the room and left. I even left a very big tip as encouragement each day, to no avail. They did manage to change the sheets and give me new towels. I was tempted to ask for another room, but the problem seemed to be systemic.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on July 4th for fireworks. Hotel is clean, but the pool is microscopic to say the least. ( I think I've seen bigger hot tubs) If you are traveling with children they will be disappionted in the pool. Also, the Inner Harbor though great during the day, got really scary at night. We sat with 6 police officers for the fireworks, but still didn't really feel safe. There was a huge fight immediately following the fireworks at the harbor. I'm not sure if this is typical of the area or not, but we will not go back. The hotel itself is OK, but I didn't think it was at all worth what we paid. The one poor guy who was trying to work the desk at check-in, was also the primary person answering phones, and although he was very polite and tried to be helpful, there is only so much one person can do. Also, there was a trash can in the parking deck area, that was not emptied for 2 days and smelled horrible. The restaurant on site was closed and no one seemed to know if other reaurants in the area served breakfast or not. If you have to go to this area, this hotel is OK, but I wouldn't go by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hoodwinked at the Sheraton Inner Habor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a quick getaway, when we made the reservations we requested a room with a Harbor View. We were assured we had a Harbor View room when we confirmed our reservation the day before we checked in. Upon arrival we waited on a long line to check in and once we were finally at the desk we noticed problem # 1, the clerk at the desk was very dry, he seemed half dead. We told him we rec'd a ticket to park in the hotel garage, he advised us parking will be $20 per day whether we move the car or not, problem # 2. This was rather upsetting since we were already spending over $500 for a 2 night stay. We get to our room pull back the curtain, and proceeded to climb over the chair and table w/lamp to get a distorted view of the Inner Harbor. Please note we had an awesome view of the Hyatt's pool and tennis court, meanwhile we paid for a harbor view. We went back downstairs to speak to the clerk that checked us in to request our room to be changed. He told us they were booked and for us to call the front desk in the morning to see if "a better room" becomes available. My husband told him we paid for a harbor view and wanted to speak with the manager. The manager promptly addressed us and took us to see a room that had a "better view of the harbor" but the room had a queen size fold out bed that was very low to the ground, that would have been perfect for a teenager. We expressed to her how displeased we were and although she was nice and apologized she didn't offer to take anything off of the bill. We left the Sheraton and walked across the street to the Hyatt to check availability, since it was the July 4th holiday weekend they were completely booked. Upon returning to the Sheraton we noticed the night shift had just clocked in so we went back to the front desk and expressed how unhappy we were and how we were assured we would receive a harbor view room when we made the reservations and confirmed and paid extra $$ for it but instead we paid extra money to see the Hyatt's pool and tennis court. The clerk was very understanding and gave us a credit of almost $50, which just about covered parking. If your looking for a CLEAN hotel with a LOVELY view of the Hyatt this is definitely the place to stay !!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ricci_N_Max
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Inner Harbor for the Saturday night over the Memorial Day weekend. It’s hard to stay much closer to all the terrific Restaurants, Aquarium, Camden Yards, and other activities of the Inner Harbor than here. Although our room was a bit odd, the living room portion of a suite with a Murphy Bed, it was still a great room, well appointed, clean and on the 10th floor with a terrific view of the Inner Harbor. This was a complimentary upgrade from the Stadium View room that we had reserved. The staff was very helpful. Underground parking ($20) was very convenient, as the last thing you need in the Inner Harbor area is a Car and parking is at a premium! The only negative was that the Pool Area was kept way too warm. Not refreshing during a heat wave weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as we'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: Octobervisit
Reviews.Content: We spent one night (a Sunday night) at the Sheraton. Concierge and front desk clerk were pleasant/helpful. We parked cars in the hotel's parking area and took them out as needed, $20 each. That worked fine. But there was a disagreeable odor about everything, stale cigarette smoke and perhaps too much deodorant sprinkled around to kill the smell. This was despite the fact that we stayed in two "non-smoking" rooms. There were gurgling noises from the plumbing when others used it and funny noises from the heating/air conditioning vent as well. We had a nice view and the beds were fine. Four elevators located together--but one of them had a problem of arriving and then refusing to take you further;the other three would not come until the faulty one had been activated. The internet blurb promised a frigo-bar in every room and in the two rooms where we stayed there were none. It looked like it HAD existed beneath the TV but had been removed. Also there was the promise of complimentary water, which indeed we received but not without asking for it twice. Breakfast in our rooms was slow in coming. It was, admittedly, a Monday morning and that may have had something to do with a feeling that the staff hadn't totally come awake by 7 AM. We had appointments to get to, so it was a little antsy waiting to see when breakfast would come. Portions were enormous and over-priced. The pastries would have tasted much better if they'd been warmed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service I ever experianced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was here on business and was not sure what to expect. I was greeted by the most friendly staff at any hotel I had ever stayed. Everyone from the front desk to house keeping to the restaurant staff was personable and friendly. They have room service available where you can fill out your request and leave it on your door for what you want and what time you want it there the next day. Everyone at the hotel makes you feel welcome which sets this hotel out from the rest. I inquired about activities and the gentleman at the concierge desk was on the phone all over the city finding things out for my group. It was a little tricky pulling into the front of the hotel but if you miss it you can just drive around the block and come back again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on the service level alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff terrible management”
Reviews.Author: cdke
Reviews.Content: Booked 8 rooms at what I thought a good rate. At check out they would not honor the rate. Check your confirmation email carefully, rate is not on all of them. Also did not confirm the rate in writing at the time of check in. So for $299 a night we got outdated small rooms, towels that belong in a motel, one room with a leaking closet, several rooms with water stains on the ceiling, free bottled water and arrogant attitude. The customer is never right and you're lucky you got a reservation. I will admit the beds were comfortable and the location for our stay was great but definitely not worth $299 a night.

Reviews.Title: “staff is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jordanthebeagle
Reviews.Content: my neighbor and i stayed at this sheraton the evening of april 8th to see an orioles/redsox game. the most outstanding factor of our stay was the staff. from kelly at the front desk who ran around trying to find my requested room to the room service person who wanted so much to please to the clerk who gave us directions, each one made our stay quite pleasant. because you can easily walk to the inner harbor or to camden yards, the location is ideal. we had an average size room with that wonderful sleeper bed that no one wants to leave. it was clean and met our needs for our stay. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the proximity to Inner Harbor activities is good, the hotel is way overpriced for what you get. We paid over $300 for a "stadium view" room and then had to pay $18 for parking to boot. We had reserved a harbor view room online but were not given one. When we brought this to the attention of the front desk, we were told that their records showed we had reserved a city view room. I rechecked our confirmation when we got home and yes, we did reserve a harbor view room. I called the hotel and our bill was adjusted by a few dollars, but we received no apology. The vanity top in the bathroom was cracked and the overall appearance of the room was worn. Next time, I'll stay at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “As expected from a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Dave148
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for one night. As previously noted, a great location. A short walk to the inner harbor area, convention center, and Camden Yards. Check in was a breeze. An large airline crew walked in just before we did. But they added an extra person behind the front desk and we checked right in. As previously noted, the beds were comfy and the bathroom needs to be updated. Although we didn't use it, the pool is rather small and shaped like a triangle. Nothing special. Parking in the hotel is $18/day with in/out priviledges. Overall, not a bad hotel for $80 through Hotwire.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Inner Harbor Hotel
